trans-unit.source: Most of these descriptors are for characters who are or become significantly nonhuman ; for example, the Dragon descriptor means you’re a four-legged, winged dragon who can breathe flame. These descriptors include suggestions for how to advance or improve your inherent nature as that sort of creature (becoming even more dragonish if you are a Dragon, for example). The GM should allow a character with such a descriptor to choose any of these abilities (and any others the GM feels are appropriate for the descriptor) in place of a type ability, either upon advancing to a new tier or selecting them as an other option of character advancement by spending 4 XP.
trans-unit.target: Most of these descriptors are for characters who are or become significantly nonhuman ; for example, the Dragon descriptor means you’re a four-legged, winged dragon who can breathe flame. These descriptors include suggestions for how to advance or improve your inherent nature as that sort of creature (becoming even more dragonish if you are a Dragon, for example). The GM should allow a character with such a descriptor to choose any of these abilities (and any others the GM feels are appropriate for the descriptor) in place of a type ability, either upon advancing to a new tier or selecting them as an other option of character advancement by spending 4 XP.

trans-unit.source: It’s Only Magic Descriptors: Chimera, Dragon, Ghost, Hunter, Nix, Sylph, Unmagical
trans-unit.target: It’s Only Magic Descriptors: Chimera, Dragon, Ghost, Hunter, Nix, Sylph, Unmagical

trans-unit.source: You have a blend of animal attributes; you may be a well-known mythological creature, like a satyr or minotaur, or you may have a unique combination of features. Bison horns, boar tusks, bear paws, a wolf’s tail, a lion’s mane: take your pick. Your thickened skin offers protection from attacks and the elements. Depending on your dexterity—and whether you have opposable thumbs—you may use adaptive weapons and tools, like a dagger modified to be held in a paw instead of a hand. You’re eager to protect the ones closest to you, and usually more likely to run toward conflict than away from it.
trans-unit.target: You have a blend of animal attributes; you may be a well-known mythological creature, like a satyr or minotaur, or you may have a unique combination of features. Bison horns, boar tusks, bear paws, a wolf’s tail, a lion’s mane: take your pick. Your thickened skin offers protection from attacks and the elements. Depending on your dexterity—and whether you have opposable thumbs—you may use adaptive weapons and tools, like a dagger modified to be held in a paw instead of a hand. You’re eager to protect the ones closest to you, and usually more likely to run toward conflict than away from it.

trans-unit.source: Animal Strength: +1 to your Might Pool.
trans-unit.target: Animal Strength: +1 to your Might Pool.

trans-unit.source: Charging Ahead: You’re trained in initiative.
trans-unit.target: Charging Ahead: You’re trained in initiative.

trans-unit.source: For the Gang: You stick up for your friends. When you draw the attack, your defense is only hindered by one step.
trans-unit.target: For the Gang: You stick up for your friends. When you draw the attack, your defense is only hindered by one step.

trans-unit.source: Ham-fisted: Tasks requiring fine motor skills are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Ham-fisted: Tasks requiring fine motor skills are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: A herd, a pride, a pack, a flock: whatever the collective noun for chimeras is, you’re looking to build (or join) one.
trans-unit.target: A herd, a pride, a pack, a flock: whatever the collective noun for chimeras is, you’re looking to build (or join) one.

trans-unit.source: You need supplies to adapt a legendary weapon perfectly to your physique.
trans-unit.target: You need supplies to adapt a legendary weapon perfectly to your physique.

trans-unit.source: The other PCs were in the wrong place at the wrong time, and you protected them from harm.
trans-unit.target: The other PCs were in the wrong place at the wrong time, and you protected them from harm.

trans-unit.source: You were held hostage by someone running a chimera fighting ring, and the other PCs freed you.
trans-unit.target: You were held hostage by someone running a chimera fighting ring, and the other PCs freed you.

trans-unit.source: You can shift at will between a dragon and humanoid form; you may choose to spend more time in one form or the other. In your dragon form you’re about 10 feet (3.5 m) long with four legs, leathery wings, and a serpentlike tail. You’re drawn to treasure and shiny things, but you’re willing to share your hoard with those you trust. Though you can speak human languages, you can’t ignore the fact that you’re a wild part of your local ecosystem—at least some of the time. You’re an apex predator, driven to fly and to hunt, and you brumate in cold temperatures like other reptiles.
trans-unit.target: You can shift at will between a dragon and humanoid form; you may choose to spend more time in one form or the other. In your dragon form you’re about 10 feet (3.5 m) long with four legs, leathery wings, and a serpentlike tail. You’re drawn to treasure and shiny things, but you’re willing to share your hoard with those you trust. Though you can speak human languages, you can’t ignore the fact that you’re a wild part of your local ecosystem—at least some of the time. You’re an apex predator, driven to fly and to hunt, and you brumate in cold temperatures like other reptiles.

trans-unit.source: Brumation is a state of sluggishness and inactivity entered by reptiles in response to low temperatures.
trans-unit.target: Brumation is a state of sluggishness and inactivity entered by reptiles in response to low temperatures.

trans-unit.source: Dragon Form: You have both a humanoid form and a dragon form, and you can switch forms up to four times in a 24-hour period. In dragon form, your Speed defense tasks are hindered due to your size. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Dragon Form: You have both a humanoid form and a dragon form, and you can switch forms up to four times in a 24-hour period. In dragon form, your Speed defense tasks are hindered due to your size. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Fireproof: +2 Armor against damage inflicted by fire or heat.
trans-unit.target: Fireproof: +2 Armor against damage inflicted by fire or heat.

trans-unit.source: Wings (1 Might point): When you have wings, you can fly a long distance as your action, or a short distance as part of another action, for up to ten minutes total. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Wings (1 Might point): When you have wings, you can fly a long distance as your action, or a short distance as part of another action, for up to ten minutes total. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Teeth: You are skilled in making unarmed bite attacks, which are a medium weapon in your dragon form and a light weapon in. your humanoid form. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Teeth: You are skilled in making unarmed bite attacks, which are a medium weapon in your dragon form and a light weapon in. your humanoid form. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Spitting Flames (1+ Might point): You can breathe a ball of fire at a target within short range, inflicting 3 points of fire damage. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can use Effort to affect more targets; each level of Effort affects one additional target. Action.
trans-unit.target: Spitting Flames (1+ Might point): You can breathe a ball of fire at a target within short range, inflicting 3 points of fire damage. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can use Effort to affect more targets; each level of Effort affects one additional target. Action.

trans-unit.source: Inability: Cold weather makes you want to burrow somewhere cozy and go dormant. Speed tasks are hindered when the temperature falls below 50°F (10°C).
trans-unit.target: Inability: Cold weather makes you want to burrow somewhere cozy and go dormant. Speed tasks are hindered when the temperature falls below 50°F (10°C).

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: The other PCs were hired as dragon hunters, but once they met you they realized their mission was misguided.
trans-unit.target: The other PCs were hired as dragon hunters, but once they met you they realized their mission was misguided.

trans-unit.source: You’re hoping to find a specific discontinued currency to add to your hoard.
trans-unit.target: You’re hoping to find a specific discontinued currency to add to your hoard.

trans-unit.source: You got stuck in your dragon form while molting, and the other PCs helped remove your shed skin.
trans-unit.target: You got stuck in your dragon form while molting, and the other PCs helped remove your shed skin.

trans-unit.source: You’re gathering ingredients for a difficult spell that will increase the range and intensity of your fire-breathing attacks.
trans-unit.target: You’re gathering ingredients for a difficult spell that will increase the range and intensity of your fire-breathing attacks.

trans-unit.source: Unfortunately, you’re dead. But hey, it’s not all bad! Your spirit has remained in the mortal world. You can still walk among the living, but you no longer need pesky things like food or sleep. It’s up to you how long you’ve been dead, whether you remember your death, and why you’ve stuck around: seeking revenge, settling a debt, protecting your descendants, perfecting your great-grandma’s pecan pie recipe, or something else entirely.
trans-unit.target: Unfortunately, you’re dead. But hey, it’s not all bad! Your spirit has remained in the mortal world. You can still walk among the living, but you no longer need pesky things like food or sleep. It’s up to you how long you’ve been dead, whether you remember your death, and why you’ve stuck around: seeking revenge, settling a debt, protecting your descendants, perfecting your great-grandma’s pecan pie recipe, or something else entirely.

trans-unit.source: Ghostly Wisdom: +2 to your Intellect Pool.
trans-unit.target: Ghostly Wisdom: +2 to your Intellect Pool.

trans-unit.source: Sneaky: You’re trained in stealth and intimidation.
trans-unit.target: Sneaky: You’re trained in stealth and intimidation.

trans-unit.source: Incorporeal: You’re trained in Speed defense.
trans-unit.target: Incorporeal: You’re trained in Speed defense.

trans-unit.source: Calling the Dead: You’re trained in communicating with other ghosts, wraiths, undead, and so on. You can also serve as a catalyst for communication with the dead, providing an asset to a living character attempting such a task (such as a séance or summoning).
trans-unit.target: Calling the Dead: You’re trained in communicating with other ghosts, wraiths, undead, and so on. You can also serve as a catalyst for communication with the dead, providing an asset to a living character attempting such a task (such as a séance or summoning).

trans-unit.source: Insubstantial: All physical attacks are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Insubstantial: All physical attacks are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Dead: Positive social interaction tasks with living creatures are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Dead: Positive social interaction tasks with living creatures are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Uniform: You’re permanently wearing the clothes you had on when you died. This can hinder social interactions if you’re inappropriately dressed for the setting (wearing a bathrobe and slippers to a formal party, for example).
trans-unit.target: Uniform: You’re permanently wearing the clothes you had on when you died. This can hinder social interactions if you’re inappropriately dressed for the setting (wearing a bathrobe and slippers to a formal party, for example).

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: You’re on a journey to make amends with someone you wronged in life.
trans-unit.target: You’re on a journey to make amends with someone you wronged in life.

trans-unit.source: You’re looking for the resting place of your physical body so you can be resurrected.
trans-unit.target: You’re looking for the resting place of your physical body so you can be resurrected.

trans-unit.source: One of the other PCs is a distant relative, and you need to keep them alive so your bloodline continues.
trans-unit.target: One of the other PCs is a distant relative, and you need to keep them alive so your bloodline continues.

trans-unit.source: You’re studying the secrets of reincarnation and suspect that one of the other PCs has vital information.
trans-unit.target: You’re studying the secrets of reincarnation and suspect that one of the other PCs has vital information.

trans-unit.source: You once rode with the Wild Hunt: an immortal cavalry who traversed the skies in secret each night, gathering the souls of those who died in battle and carrying them to the beyond. These days, the Wild Hunt has downsized and your nights are your own. You’re mortal again, too, but it’s impossible to forget the terrifying freedom and power you once held. Maybe you’ve let nostalgia make you bitter, or maybe you don’t miss the Hunt at all, instead living in fear of being conscripted once more.
trans-unit.target: You once rode with the Wild Hunt: an immortal cavalry who traversed the skies in secret each night, gathering the souls of those who died in battle and carrying them to the beyond. These days, the Wild Hunt has downsized and your nights are your own. You’re mortal again, too, but it’s impossible to forget the terrifying freedom and power you once held. Maybe you’ve let nostalgia make you bitter, or maybe you don’t miss the Hunt at all, instead living in fear of being conscripted once more.

trans-unit.source: Equestrian: You’re trained in handling and riding horses.
trans-unit.target: Equestrian: You’re trained in handling and riding horses.

trans-unit.source: Sword Hand: You’re proficient with two-handed swords and can use them without penalty.
trans-unit.target: Sword Hand: You’re proficient with two-handed swords and can use them without penalty.

trans-unit.source: Hearing the Dead: You’re skilled in all social interactions with ghosts.
trans-unit.target: Hearing the Dead: You’re skilled in all social interactions with ghosts.

trans-unit.source: The Call of the Hunt: You’re often distracted by sounds that remind you of the Wild Hunt, such as horns and baying hounds. Tasks requiring concentration are hindered.
trans-unit.target: The Call of the Hunt: You’re often distracted by sounds that remind you of the Wild Hunt, such as horns and baying hounds. Tasks requiring concentration are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Lost Years: In the years you belonged to the Wild Hunt, you lost touch with advancing technology. Tasks involving computers, pop culture, and recent history are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Lost Years: In the years you belonged to the Wild Hunt, you lost touch with advancing technology. Tasks involving computers, pop culture, and recent history are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: You ferried the soul of a PC’s relative to the afterlife. When you left the Wild Hunt, you found the PC to tell them of their relative’s brave deeds.
trans-unit.target: You ferried the soul of a PC’s relative to the afterlife. When you left the Wild Hunt, you found the PC to tell them of their relative’s brave deeds.

trans-unit.source: The living only see the Wild Hunt cross the sky if they’re destined for disaster. A PC saw the Wild Hunt years ago, and you’ve taken it upon yourself to protect them.
trans-unit.target: The living only see the Wild Hunt cross the sky if they’re destined for disaster. A PC saw the Wild Hunt years ago, and you’ve taken it upon yourself to protect them.

trans-unit.source: You’re afraid that the leader of the Wild Hunt will summon you, and you need help concealing yourself.
trans-unit.target: You’re afraid that the leader of the Wild Hunt will summon you, and you need help concealing yourself.

trans-unit.source: You’re searching for the horse you remember riding—a massive undead stallion with flaming hooves.
trans-unit.target: You’re searching for the horse you remember riding—a massive undead stallion with flaming hooves.

trans-unit.source: You’re a shapeshifting water spirit. You can walk on two legs and breathe air, but when you’re submerged, you gain a tail, fins, and gills. You probably live near flowing water, with no preference for salinity or temperature; you also have a general affinity for nature and a knack for identifying useful plants. Your playful and upbeat disposition doesn’t mean you’re passive or helpless. Though you may prefer to talk your way out of tough situations, you’re quick to react to threats—especially in water, where you maneuver with deadly accuracy.
trans-unit.target: You’re a shapeshifting water spirit. You can walk on two legs and breathe air, but when you’re submerged, you gain a tail, fins, and gills. You probably live near flowing water, with no preference for salinity or temperature; you also have a general affinity for nature and a knack for identifying useful plants. Your playful and upbeat disposition doesn’t mean you’re passive or helpless. Though you may prefer to talk your way out of tough situations, you’re quick to react to threats—especially in water, where you maneuver with deadly accuracy.

trans-unit.source: Transformation: When submerged in water, you transform into a fish/human hybrid with gills, fins, sharp teeth, and a tail. This transformation is automatic. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Transformation: When submerged in water, you transform into a fish/human hybrid with gills, fins, sharp teeth, and a tail. This transformation is automatic. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Unchillable: +2 Armor against damage caused by cold or ice.
trans-unit.target: Unchillable: +2 Armor against damage caused by cold or ice.

trans-unit.source: Sharp Teeth: You are skilled in making an unarmed bite attack, which is a medium weapon in your aquatic form and a light weapon in your humanoid form. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Sharp Teeth: You are skilled in making an unarmed bite attack, which is a medium weapon in your aquatic form and a light weapon in your humanoid form. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Quick Swimming: You can swim a long distance as your action, or a short distance as part of another action.
trans-unit.target: Quick Swimming: You can swim a long distance as your action, or a short distance as part of another action.

trans-unit.source: Close to Nature: You’re skilled in identifying plants and animals.
trans-unit.target: Close to Nature: You’re skilled in identifying plants and animals.

trans-unit.source: Siren Song: You’re extremely charismatic. You’re skilled in persuasion and deception.
trans-unit.target: Siren Song: You’re extremely charismatic. You’re skilled in persuasion and deception.

trans-unit.source: Distractible: You have a hard time focusing. You’re hindered in tasks involving knowledge or lore, as well as resisting mental attacks.
trans-unit.target: Distractible: You have a hard time focusing. You’re hindered in tasks involving knowledge or lore, as well as resisting mental attacks.

trans-unit.source: Inability: When you’re in water, attacks using weapons are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: When you’re in water, attacks using weapons are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: The other PCs were stranded in a shipwreck, and you saved them.
trans-unit.target: The other PCs were stranded in a shipwreck, and you saved them.

trans-unit.source: A factory is polluting your local body of water, and you’re looking for revenge.
trans-unit.target: A factory is polluting your local body of water, and you’re looking for revenge.

trans-unit.source: You played a prank on the other PCs while they were swimming; after a good laugh, they invited you to join them.
trans-unit.target: You played a prank on the other PCs while they were swimming; after a good laugh, they invited you to join them.

trans-unit.source: You’ve been sent to search for a rare plant, believed by many to be extinct.
trans-unit.target: You’ve been sent to search for a rare plant, believed by many to be extinct.

trans-unit.source: You’re an air spirit, with the gift of wingless flight and hawklike eyes. You’re happiest when you have an aerial view; you lean more toward strategy than action, calling the shots from an unmatched vantage point. Your sensitivity to air currents and atmospheric pressure means you’re able to predict weather patterns, which you incorporate into your machinations.
trans-unit.target: You’re an air spirit, with the gift of wingless flight and hawklike eyes. You’re happiest when you have an aerial view; you lean more toward strategy than action, calling the shots from an unmatched vantage point. Your sensitivity to air currents and atmospheric pressure means you’re able to predict weather patterns, which you incorporate into your machinations.

trans-unit.source: Master Plans: +2 to your Intellect or Speed Pool.
trans-unit.target: Master Plans: +2 to your Intellect or Speed Pool.

trans-unit.source: Sylph Flight (2 Intellect or Speed points): You can fly a long distance as your action, or a short distance as part of another action, for up to ten minutes total. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Sylph Flight (2 Intellect or Speed points): You can fly a long distance as your action, or a short distance as part of another action, for up to ten minutes total. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Top-Down Strategy: You’re skilled in logistics and planning.
trans-unit.target: Top-Down Strategy: You’re skilled in logistics and planning.

trans-unit.source: Sharp Vision: You’re trained in visual perception.
trans-unit.target: Sharp Vision: You’re trained in visual perception.

trans-unit.source: Oncoming Storm (1 Intellect point): You can predict weather patterns (approaching storm systems, cloud cover, wind direction) for the next twelve hours. Action.
trans-unit.target: Oncoming Storm (1 Intellect point): You can predict weather patterns (approaching storm systems, cloud cover, wind direction) for the next twelve hours. Action.

trans-unit.source: Fragile: Might defense tasks are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Fragile: Might defense tasks are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: You saw the other PCs headed toward danger and called out a warning before the situation turned sour.
trans-unit.target: You saw the other PCs headed toward danger and called out a warning before the situation turned sour.

trans-unit.source: You got in trouble for flying in restricted airspace, and the other PCs helped cover for you.
trans-unit.target: You got in trouble for flying in restricted airspace, and the other PCs helped cover for you.

trans-unit.source: You need help with a spell that will enable you to communicate with birds of prey.
trans-unit.target: You need help with a spell that will enable you to communicate with birds of prey.

trans-unit.source: You helped the other PCs recover a kite that became tangled in tree branches and power lines.
trans-unit.target: You helped the other PCs recover a kite that became tangled in tree branches and power lines.

trans-unit.source: You’re not good at using magic. In fact, it’s clear that you’re inherently unmagical—magic is as confusing, difficult, and awkward for you as learning lava spells would be for a frost giant. It’s not that you don’t believe in magic (though maybe you don’t) or that you don’t like magic (though maybe you don’t). It’s just that you and magic are incompatible. You’ve learned to compensate for this problem and even turn it into an advantage in some cases.
trans-unit.target: You’re not good at using magic. In fact, it’s clear that you’re inherently unmagical—magic is as confusing, difficult, and awkward for you as learning lava spells would be for a frost giant. It’s not that you don’t believe in magic (though maybe you don’t) or that you don’t like magic (though maybe you don’t). It’s just that you and magic are incompatible. You’ve learned to compensate for this problem and even turn it into an advantage in some cases.

trans-unit.source: An Unmagical character shouldn’t be able to overcome their inability by becoming trained in magic. The GM might allow them to train away part of the inability with training in specific skills, such as “Onslaught” or “magical weapons.”
trans-unit.target: An Unmagical character shouldn’t be able to overcome their inability by becoming trained in magic. The GM might allow them to train away part of the inability with training in specific skills, such as “Onslaught” or “magical weapons.”

trans-unit.source: Playing an Adept or Speaker character with the Unmagical descriptor is a challenge, as their abilities mostly stem from supernatural power and therefore all of them would be hindered. This descriptor is mainly for Warriors and Explorers who want to play up their not inherently magical nature.
trans-unit.target: Playing an Adept or Speaker character with the Unmagical descriptor is a challenge, as their abilities mostly stem from supernatural power and therefore all of them would be hindered. This descriptor is mainly for Warriors and Explorers who want to play up their not inherently magical nature.

trans-unit.source: Make Do With the Mundane: +1 to each of your Pools.
trans-unit.target: Make Do With the Mundane: +1 to each of your Pools.

trans-unit.source: Resistant to Magic: You are trained in all defense rolls against magic, spells, and magical effects.
trans-unit.target: Resistant to Magic: You are trained in all defense rolls against magic, spells, and magical effects.

trans-unit.source: Inability: All actions using magic (including casting spells and using magic objects) are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: All actions using magic (including casting spells and using magic objects) are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Magical Failure: Your unmagical nature means magic goes awry more often. For any task relating to or interacting with magic, you trigger a GM intrusion on a d20 roll of 1 or 2.
trans-unit.target: Magical Failure: Your unmagical nature means magic goes awry more often. For any task relating to or interacting with magic, you trigger a GM intrusion on a d20 roll of 1 or 2.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: One of the other PCs initially diagnosed you as unmagical, which made a lot of your life suddenly make sense.
trans-unit.target: One of the other PCs initially diagnosed you as unmagical, which made a lot of your life suddenly make sense.

trans-unit.source: You think this group of PCs might be on track to figuring out why some people are unmagical and perhaps “fixing” them.
trans-unit.target: You think this group of PCs might be on track to figuring out why some people are unmagical and perhaps “fixing” them.

trans-unit.source: You and the other PCs have the same rival or foe—someone who once tried using magic on you and failed spectacularly.
trans-unit.target: You and the other PCs have the same rival or foe—someone who once tried using magic on you and failed spectacularly.

trans-unit.source: You volunteered because you knew your inherent resistance to magic would be useful to the group.
trans-unit.target: You volunteered because you knew your inherent resistance to magic would be useful to the group.

trans-unit.source: This section presents new foci that can be used as-is in most modern fantasy campaigns. Each of them has an expanded description with more story details than the foci in the Cypher System Rulebook (which have short, broad descriptions suitable for other genres). The GM and player should adjust these details to suit the specific campaign they’ll be playing.
trans-unit.target: This section presents new foci that can be used as-is in most modern fantasy campaigns. Each of them has an expanded description with more story details than the foci in the Cypher System Rulebook (which have short, broad descriptions suitable for other genres). The GM and player should adjust these details to suit the specific campaign they’ll be playing.

trans-unit.source: You are a maker, a crafter, but you use a unique combination of code and magic instead of wood, steel, or circuit boards. Like anyone who’s spent a lot of time working on a computer, you’ve learned some strange secrets, not all of them entirely legal, and you know a lot about games, people, and how things work. More than just a computer nerd, you’re a developer and (although you might not admit it) a hacker. Most of your specialized gear is hardware or software for your computer or smart device, so you can dress however you want. You’re probably used to wearing comfortable clothes, sitting for hours at a time, and enjoying many caffeinated beverages (that have permanently discolored some of your clothing).
trans-unit.target: You are a maker, a crafter, but you use a unique combination of code and magic instead of wood, steel, or circuit boards. Like anyone who’s spent a lot of time working on a computer, you’ve learned some strange secrets, not all of them entirely legal, and you know a lot about games, people, and how things work. More than just a computer nerd, you’re a developer and (although you might not admit it) a hacker. Most of your specialized gear is hardware or software for your computer or smart device, so you can dress however you want. You’re probably used to wearing comfortable clothes, sitting for hours at a time, and enjoying many caffeinated beverages (that have permanently discolored some of your clothing).

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You once created a magical app to help get them out of a sticky situation (parking ticket, failing grade, clingy relationship, and so on).
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You once created a magical app to help get them out of a sticky situation (parking ticket, failing grade, clingy relationship, and so on).

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You know they know an embarrassing or incriminating secret about you.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You know they know an embarrassing or incriminating secret about you.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. Something about this person annoys or distracts you so that when they’re within immediate range, your tasks with computers and magical lore are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. Something about this person annoys or distracts you so that when they’re within immediate range, your tasks with computers and magical lore are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. Every now and then, you’re able to copy a magical app cypher and send it to them (effectively creating a duplicate of one of yours).
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. Every now and then, you’re able to copy a magical app cypher and send it to them (effectively creating a duplicate of one of yours).

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: Computer (laptop or desktop) and a smartphone or tablet.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: Computer (laptop or desktop) and a smartphone or tablet.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: Your next use of a magical app cypher within the next hour is eased. Major Effect Suggestion: Your next use of a magical app cypher within the next day is eased.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: Your next use of a magical app cypher within the next hour is eased. Major Effect Suggestion: Your next use of a magical app cypher within the next day is eased.

trans-unit.source: Magical Programmer: You are trained in crafting magical apps and in using (and exploiting) computer software. You know one or more computer languages well enough to write basic programs, and you are fluent in internet protocol. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Magical Programmer: You are trained in crafting magical apps and in using (and exploiting) computer software. You know one or more computer languages well enough to write basic programs, and you are fluent in internet protocol. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: App Tinkerer: If you spend at least one day tinkering with a magical app in your possession, it functions at one level higher than normal. This applies to all magical apps in your possession, but they retain this bonus only for you. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: App Tinkerer: If you spend at least one day tinkering with a magical app in your possession, it functions at one level higher than normal. This applies to all magical apps in your possession, but they retain this bonus only for you. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Confidence Artist or Master Magical Programmer as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Confidence Artist or Master Magical Programmer as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Master Magical Programmer: You are specialized in crafting magical apps and in using (and exploiting) computer software. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Master Magical Programmer: You are specialized in crafting magical apps and in using (and exploiting) computer software. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Magical App Hacker: All magical app cyphers you use function at one level higher than normal. If given a week, you can tinker with one of your magical app cyphers, transforming it into another magical app cypher of the same type that you had in the past. The GM and player should collaborate to ensure that the transformation is logical—for example, a magical app that creates a fiery explosion probably can’t be turned into a healing app. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Magical App Hacker: All magical app cyphers you use function at one level higher than normal. If given a week, you can tinker with one of your magical app cyphers, transforming it into another magical app cypher of the same type that you had in the past. The GM and player should collaborate to ensure that the transformation is logical—for example, a magical app that creates a fiery explosion probably can’t be turned into a healing app. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Call in Favor or Usurp Cypher as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Call in Favor or Usurp Cypher as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: You blend sorcery and firearms into an amazing mix of magic and technology. Bullets and spells are almost interchangeable to you; your magic has a firearm motif and you cast using your gun. You might be a trick-shot sorcerer, a magical member of the armed forces, or an outlaw with a flair for arcane power. Gun nuts and wizard purists might look down on your blended technique, but you can do things that nobody else can do. You might call yourself a guncaster, spellshooter, or triggermage. You wear clothing that leaves your arms and hands free to use your weapon and cast spells, preferring something more flashy than a gunslinger’s long coat and more intimidating than typical magician or witch clothing.
trans-unit.target: You blend sorcery and firearms into an amazing mix of magic and technology. Bullets and spells are almost interchangeable to you; your magic has a firearm motif and you cast using your gun. You might be a trick-shot sorcerer, a magical member of the armed forces, or an outlaw with a flair for arcane power. Gun nuts and wizard purists might look down on your blended technique, but you can do things that nobody else can do. You might call yourself a guncaster, spellshooter, or triggermage. You wear clothing that leaves your arms and hands free to use your weapon and cast spells, preferring something more flashy than a gunslinger’s long coat and more intimidating than typical magician or witch clothing.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You once grazed this character with one of your spell bullets; it’s up to them whether they’ve forgiven you or still resent you for it.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You once grazed this character with one of your spell bullets; it’s up to them whether they’ve forgiven you or still resent you for it.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You’ve accidentally discovered that you can shoot their spells out of your gun just like you do with your own spells, but the PC must be touchingyour gun while you fire it.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You’ve accidentally discovered that you can shoot their spells out of your gun just like you do with your own spells, but the PC must be touchingyour gun while you fire it.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. Based on your interactions, you think this character resents your use of guns, magic, or both.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. Based on your interactions, you think this character resents your use of guns, magic, or both.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. This character can barely hear your gunshots (magical or otherwise), which are no louder than a whisper to them.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. This character can barely hear your gunshots (magical or otherwise), which are no louder than a whisper to them.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: Medium or heavy handgun.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: Medium or heavy handgun.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: The attack hits the side of the foe’s head, deafening them for a few minutes. Major Effect Suggestion: The foe’s major blood vessel is hit, causing them to bleed 1 point of damage each round until someone succeeds at a difficulty 3 Intellect or Speed task to bind the wound.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: The attack hits the side of the foe’s head, deafening them for a few minutes. Major Effect Suggestion: The foe’s major blood vessel is hit, causing them to bleed 1 point of damage each round until someone succeeds at a difficulty 3 Intellect or Speed task to bind the wound.

trans-unit.source: Spell Bullet: In your hands, a typical handgun or rifle never needs to be loaded because you can automatically conjure a standard bullet for it as part of your attack action with that weapon. Alternatively, instead of casting a spell in the normal manner, you can channel it through your handgun, firing it like a bullet. This is as loud as firing a normal bullet and uses the handgun’s range (typically long) if that is longer than the spell’s normal range. If the spell is an attack spell, instead of making an Intellect-based attack you make a Speed-based attack; assets and skill with guns apply to the attack, and you use your Speed Pool if you apply Effort to ease the attack. This means you use Intellect to cast the spell (and for applying Effort for additional effects or extra damage) and Speed for the attack roll (using Intellect Edge and Speed Edge for their respective Pools). Enabler. You can use Spell Bullet to cast a spell that affects multiple targets. This might look like you’re firing multiple times or the one shot is passing through or ricocheting off each target.
trans-unit.target: Spell Bullet: In your hands, a typical handgun or rifle never needs to be loaded because you can automatically conjure a standard bullet for it as part of your attack action with that weapon. Alternatively, instead of casting a spell in the normal manner, you can channel it through your handgun, firing it like a bullet. This is as loud as firing a normal bullet and uses the handgun’s range (typically long) if that is longer than the spell’s normal range. If the spell is an attack spell, instead of making an Intellect-based attack you make a Speed-based attack; assets and skill with guns apply to the attack, and you use your Speed Pool if you apply Effort to ease the attack. This means you use Intellect to cast the spell (and for applying Effort for additional effects or extra damage) and Speed for the attack roll (using Intellect Edge and Speed Edge for their respective Pools). Enabler. You can use Spell Bullet to cast a spell that affects multiple targets. This might look like you’re firing multiple times or the one shot is passing through or ricocheting off each target.

trans-unit.source: Gun Jammer (2+ Intellect points): You can interfere with a firearm so the next time it is used, it jams or misfires. The weapon must be within short range and you must be able to see it. Make an Intellect-based attack against the weapon or its bearer (whichever level is higher). If you succeed, the next attack with the firearm fails, and the weapon won’t fire until someone uses an action to correct the problem. If you activate this ability when it isn’t your turn, your attack against the weapon is hindered. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can use Effort to affect more firearms; each level of Effort affects one additional target. Action or enabler.
trans-unit.target: Gun Jammer (2+ Intellect points): You can interfere with a firearm so the next time it is used, it jams or misfires. The weapon must be within short range and you must be able to see it. Make an Intellect-based attack against the weapon or its bearer (whichever level is higher). If you succeed, the next attack with the firearm fails, and the weapon won’t fire until someone uses an action to correct the problem. If you activate this ability when it isn’t your turn, your attack against the weapon is hindered. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can use Effort to affect more firearms; each level of Effort affects one additional target. Action or enabler.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Iron Eye or Trained Guncasting as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Iron Eye or Trained Guncasting as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Iron Eye: You inflict an additional 3 points of damage with any single-target attack spell cast through a firearm using Spell Bullet. If the attack spell doesn’t inflict damage, you instead can modify the spell as if you had applied a level of Intellect Effort to it. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Iron Eye: You inflict an additional 3 points of damage with any single-target attack spell cast through a firearm using Spell Bullet. If the attack spell doesn’t inflict damage, you instead can modify the spell as if you had applied a level of Intellect Effort to it. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Trained Guncasting: You are trained in using guns (whether firing normal bullets or Spell Bullets). Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Trained Guncasting: You are trained in using guns (whether firing normal bullets or Spell Bullets). Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Hasty Guncasting: You can make two gun attacks as a single action; one is a spell (using Spell Bullet) and the other is a normal gunshot. You can make these attacks in either order, but the second one is hindered by two steps. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Hasty Guncasting: You can make two gun attacks as a single action; one is a spell (using Spell Bullet) and the other is a normal gunshot. You can make these attacks in either order, but the second one is hindered by two steps. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Bullet Jaunt (5 Intellect points): Every Spell Bullet you fire leaves a faint path of magic that you can see and follow. Choose the path of one Spell Bullet within long range that you fired in the past minute; you instantly teleport to any place you want along its path. Alternatively, you can use Spell Bullet to conjure a standard bullet, fire it at a target within gun range, and jaunt as part of the action of firing the bullet. Action to teleport along an existing path or to fire a bullet and teleport along its path.
trans-unit.target: Bullet Jaunt (5 Intellect points): Every Spell Bullet you fire leaves a faint path of magic that you can see and follow. Choose the path of one Spell Bullet within long range that you fired in the past minute; you instantly teleport to any place you want along its path. Alternatively, you can use Spell Bullet to conjure a standard bullet, fire it at a target within gun range, and jaunt as part of the action of firing the bullet. Action to teleport along an existing path or to fire a bullet and teleport along its path.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Deadeye or Special Shot as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Deadeye or Special Shot as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Deadeye: You inflict an additional 6 points of damage with any single-target attack spell cast through a firearm using Spell Bullet. If the attack spell doesn’t inflict damage, you instead can modify the spell as if you had applied two levels of Intellect Effort to it. If you have the Iron Eye ability, you can exchange it for Trained Guncasting. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Deadeye: You inflict an additional 6 points of damage with any single-target attack spell cast through a firearm using Spell Bullet. If the attack spell doesn’t inflict damage, you instead can modify the spell as if you had applied two levels of Intellect Effort to it. If you have the Iron Eye ability, you can exchange it for Trained Guncasting. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: You know enough about magic to mistrust anyone who uses it, especially witches—people who study ancient rituals, make pacts with evil creatures, and use their power for personal gain. Warped by their abilities, they are dangerous threats to regular folks, and it’s up to people like you to find and eliminate those threats. Sure, some witches claim to be good and even act friendly, but you’ve seen it go bad all too often, and you won’t be fooled again. You always carry weapons for fighting witches, or at least know what common tools will do as a weapon in a pinch. You wear clothing appropriate to the region and era (especially if regular people don’t know about magic or witches and you have to hide what you do). You may have a token, icon, or other reminder of your purpose, such as a lucky coin, a holy book, or a pouch of magic-thwarting herbs given to you by your mentor.
trans-unit.target: You know enough about magic to mistrust anyone who uses it, especially witches—people who study ancient rituals, make pacts with evil creatures, and use their power for personal gain. Warped by their abilities, they are dangerous threats to regular folks, and it’s up to people like you to find and eliminate those threats. Sure, some witches claim to be good and even act friendly, but you’ve seen it go bad all too often, and you won’t be fooled again. You always carry weapons for fighting witches, or at least know what common tools will do as a weapon in a pinch. You wear clothing appropriate to the region and era (especially if regular people don’t know about magic or witches and you have to hide what you do). You may have a token, icon, or other reminder of your purpose, such as a lucky coin, a holy book, or a pouch of magic-thwarting herbs given to you by your mentor.

trans-unit.source: What a “witch” is depends on the setting. In a setting where magic is rare or secret, superstitious people might consider anyone who uses magic to be a dangerous witch. In a different setting, “witch” might refer to a specific organization of people who know how to use magic.
trans-unit.target: What a “witch” is depends on the setting. In a setting where magic is rare or secret, superstitious people might consider anyone who uses magic to be a dangerous witch. In a different setting, “witch” might refer to a specific organization of people who know how to use magic.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You are friends, and you’d hate to see anything bad happen to them.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You are friends, and you’d hate to see anything bad happen to them.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You know that some mysterious quality about them makes witches tend to choose them as targets over other people.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You know that some mysterious quality about them makes witches tend to choose them as targets over other people.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You know they’ve had a run-in with a witch before, and you want to hear how that played out.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You know they’ve had a run-in with a witch before, and you want to hear how that played out.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You’ve known this person quite a while, and in fact it was a witch attack against them that convinced you to start hunting witches.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You’ve known this person quite a while, and in fact it was a witch attack against them that convinced you to start hunting witches.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: A book of lore about witches, passed down to you from past witch hunters and updated over the years (or decades or centuries) with their advice and discoveries about witches.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: A book of lore about witches, passed down to you from past witch hunters and updated over the years (or decades or centuries) with their advice and discoveries about witches.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: You intimidate your foe so much that they pause, taking no action on their next turn (but they’re still able to defend themselves). Major Effect Suggestion: You are so intimidating that your foe chooses to flee, or at least retreat a bit to recover its courage and think of a new strategy.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: You intimidate your foe so much that they pause, taking no action on their next turn (but they’re still able to defend themselves). Major Effect Suggestion: You are so intimidating that your foe chooses to flee, or at least retreat a bit to recover its courage and think of a new strategy.

trans-unit.source: Witch Bane: You inflict 1 additional point of damage with weapons. When you inflict damage to witches (or other intelligent creatures who cast spells), you inflict 3 additional points of damage. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Witch Bane: You inflict 1 additional point of damage with weapons. When you inflict damage to witches (or other intelligent creatures who cast spells), you inflict 3 additional points of damage. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Witch Lore: You are trained in the traditional names, habits, suspected lairs, and related topics regarding the witches of your world. You know enough of at least one quasi-magical language (such as Latin or Ancient Greek) that you can make yourself understood to them. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Witch Lore: You are trained in the traditional names, habits, suspected lairs, and related topics regarding the witches of your world. You know enough of at least one quasi-magical language (such as Latin or Ancient Greek) that you can make yourself understood to them. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Improved Witch Bane or Misdirect as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Improved Witch Bane or Misdirect as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Improved Witch Bane: When you inflict damage to witches (or other intelligent creatures who cast spells), you inflict 3 additional points of damage. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Improved Witch Bane: When you inflict damage to witches (or other intelligent creatures who cast spells), you inflict 3 additional points of damage. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Countercharm (5 Intellect points): If you are affected by an unwanted ongoing magical condition or affliction (such as a curse, paralysis spell, withering hex, and so on) that gives you additional rolls to end it early, your rolls to end it early are eased by two steps until you break free. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Countercharm (5 Intellect points): If you are affected by an unwanted ongoing magical condition or affliction (such as a curse, paralysis spell, withering hex, and so on) that gives you additional rolls to end it early, your rolls to end it early are eased by two steps until you break free. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Hard to Kill or Heroic Witch Bane as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Hard to Kill or Heroic Witch Bane as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Heroic Witch Bane: When you inflict damage to witches (or other intelligent creatures who cast spells), you inflict 3 additional points of damage. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Heroic Witch Bane: When you inflict damage to witches (or other intelligent creatures who cast spells), you inflict 3 additional points of damage. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Your enchanted heritage is etched upon you. Studying strange formulas, mystic runes, and magical glyphs to learn spells is one thing. Making spells truly a part of you is another, but that’s exactly what you do when you apply magical inks to create intricate spell tattoos across your body. Each tattoo you inscribe on yourself is not merely a design, but the keystone of a spell, giving you the ability to cast it. Because your tattoos are magical, you can continually add to those you’ve already accumulated without ruining the designs, allowing your mastery over magic to grow. You often wear clothing that bares your arms and perhaps other parts of your body to expose your tattoos, so that others know you for a spellcaster.
trans-unit.target: Your enchanted heritage is etched upon you. Studying strange formulas, mystic runes, and magical glyphs to learn spells is one thing. Making spells truly a part of you is another, but that’s exactly what you do when you apply magical inks to create intricate spell tattoos across your body. Each tattoo you inscribe on yourself is not merely a design, but the keystone of a spell, giving you the ability to cast it. Because your tattoos are magical, you can continually add to those you’ve already accumulated without ruining the designs, allowing your mastery over magic to grow. You often wear clothing that bares your arms and perhaps other parts of your body to expose your tattoos, so that others know you for a spellcaster.

trans-unit.source: Readying Spell Tattoos: You learn two abilities (spells) at every tier of this focus, and each of them becomes a tattoo on your body. However, for each tier’s spells, you can only have one of the two readied (available for casting) at any given time, and the other is merely an interesting design until you change your readied spell for that tier. To change one readied spell, immediately after using a one-hour or ten-hour recovery roll, you must spend one minute in meditation, after which you can swap one readied spell.
trans-unit.target: Readying Spell Tattoos: You learn two abilities (spells) at every tier of this focus, and each of them becomes a tattoo on your body. However, for each tier’s spells, you can only have one of the two readied (available for casting) at any given time, and the other is merely an interesting design until you change your readied spell for that tier. To change one readied spell, immediately after using a one-hour or ten-hour recovery roll, you must spend one minute in meditation, after which you can swap one readied spell.

trans-unit.source: The Inks Spells on Skin focus works similarly to the Masters Spells focus. The GM may consider allowing characters with either of these foci to choose abilities from either focus when they advance to a new tier.
trans-unit.target: The Inks Spells on Skin focus works similarly to the Masters Spells focus. The GM may consider allowing characters with either of these foci to choose abilities from either focus when they advance to a new tier.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. They once broke a bottle of one of your magical tattoo inks. It’s up to you if you’ve forgiven them or not.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. They once broke a bottle of one of your magical tattoo inks. It’s up to you if you’ve forgiven them or not.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You think they could learn your tattoo magic, and you’d like to teach them. They may or may not be interested in learning it.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You think they could learn your tattoo magic, and you’d like to teach them. They may or may not be interested in learning it.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. Whenever you ready your spells for the day, this character feels faint pain on their body where your corresponding tattoo is.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. Whenever you ready your spells for the day, this character feels faint pain on their body where your corresponding tattoo is.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. This character asked you to give them a tattoo, so you did. Somehow, now you can always sense their general direction and distance from you.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. This character asked you to give them a tattoo, so you did. Somehow, now you can always sense their general direction and distance from you.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: Special ink, a tattooing needle, and a clay, stone, or wooden tablet marked with strange glyphs.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: Special ink, a tattooing needle, and a clay, stone, or wooden tablet marked with strange glyphs.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: Exposed skin on the target creature is marked with a glowing glyph of your choice for one hour. Major Effect Suggestion: The foe is cursed, hindering all their actions for one minute.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: Exposed skin on the target creature is marked with a glowing glyph of your choice for one hour. Major Effect Suggestion: The foe is cursed, hindering all their actions for one minute.

trans-unit.source: Poison Touch (2 Intellect points): You touch a creature and lines of poison crawl through their skin. They take 3 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) and are hindered on their next turn. Action.
trans-unit.target: Poison Touch (2 Intellect points): You touch a creature and lines of poison crawl through their skin. They take 3 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor) and are hindered on their next turn. Action.

trans-unit.source: Eclipse (2 Intellect points): You drain the light from an immediate area within long range. Bright light (like a sunny day outdoors) becomes dim light, normal light (like inside a well-lit room) becomes very dim light, and anything darker becomes darkness. If you cast this spell on an object, the darkness moves with the object, and can be suppressed if it is enclosed in a light-proof container or wrapping. Action.
trans-unit.target: Eclipse (2 Intellect points): You drain the light from an immediate area within long range. Bright light (like a sunny day outdoors) becomes dim light, normal light (like inside a well-lit room) becomes very dim light, and anything darker becomes darkness. If you cast this spell on an object, the darkness moves with the object, and can be suppressed if it is enclosed in a light-proof container or wrapping. Action.

trans-unit.source: Mist Form (4 Intellect points): You change into a cloud of mist for up to ten minutes, filling an immediate area. You gain an asset to sneaking tasks and Speed defense tasks, but you lose the benefit of any armor you wear. You can pass through any barrier that allows air to move through it (such as a fence, wire screen, cloth, or pipe), moving up to an immediate distance each round. You can’t affect or be affected by normal matter, but energy attacks (like fire or explosions) and mental attacks still affect you. You cannot speak but can still use abilities that don’t rely on human speech or affecting physical matter (other than yourself). If large portions of the mist are separated (such as behind a closed door) when you return to human form, you move one step down the damage track. Action to change or revert.
trans-unit.target: Mist Form (4 Intellect points): You change into a cloud of mist for up to ten minutes, filling an immediate area. You gain an asset to sneaking tasks and Speed defense tasks, but you lose the benefit of any armor you wear. You can pass through any barrier that allows air to move through it (such as a fence, wire screen, cloth, or pipe), moving up to an immediate distance each round. You can’t affect or be affected by normal matter, but energy attacks (like fire or explosions) and mental attacks still affect you. You cannot speak but can still use abilities that don’t rely on human speech or affecting physical matter (other than yourself). If large portions of the mist are separated (such as behind a closed door) when you return to human form, you move one step down the damage track. Action to change or revert.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose any two of the following as your tier 3 ability: Command, Lightning Flash, or Outwit.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose any two of the following as your tier 3 ability: Command, Lightning Flash, or Outwit.

trans-unit.source: Lightning Flash (4+ Intellect points): Lightning strikes within long range, filling an immediate area and inflicting 3 points of damage on all affected creatures. Effort applied to one attack counts for all attacks against targets in the area of the flash. Even on an unsuccessful attack, a creature in the area still takes 1 point of damage. Your attack is eased against targets wearing, carrying, or made of a significant amount of metal. Action.
trans-unit.target: Lightning Flash (4+ Intellect points): Lightning strikes within long range, filling an immediate area and inflicting 3 points of damage on all affected creatures. Effort applied to one attack counts for all attacks against targets in the area of the flash. Even on an unsuccessful attack, a creature in the area still takes 1 point of damage. Your attack is eased against targets wearing, carrying, or made of a significant amount of metal. Action.

trans-unit.source: Incapacitate (4 Intellect points): You use necromantic magic to make one creature in short range fall prone and be unable to take actions for one round. Action.
trans-unit.target: Incapacitate (4 Intellect points): You use necromantic magic to make one creature in short range fall prone and be unable to take actions for one round. Action.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose any two of the following as your tier 6 ability: Divide Your Mind, Petrify, or Summon Demon.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose any two of the following as your tier 6 ability: Divide Your Mind, Petrify, or Summon Demon.

trans-unit.source: Petrify (6+ Intellect points): You slowly transform a creature within short range into lifeless stone. The target must be level 2 or lower. If your attack succeeds, the creature takes 6 points of damage and moves one step down the damage track as their flesh begins to mineralize. If the transformation is not interrupted by the end of your next turn, the creature fully becomes a harmless stone statue. You can cast this spell to restore a petrified target back into their living self. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can use Effort to increase the maximum level of the target. Thus, to petrify a level 6 target (four levels above the normal limit), you must apply four levels of Effort. Action.
trans-unit.target: Petrify (6+ Intellect points): You slowly transform a creature within short range into lifeless stone. The target must be level 2 or lower. If your attack succeeds, the creature takes 6 points of damage and moves one step down the damage track as their flesh begins to mineralize. If the transformation is not interrupted by the end of your next turn, the creature fully becomes a harmless stone statue. You can cast this spell to restore a petrified target back into their living self. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can use Effort to increase the maximum level of the target. Thus, to petrify a level 6 target (four levels above the normal limit), you must apply four levels of Effort. Action.

trans-unit.source: Your skill behind the wheel is legendary, combining natural talent and specialized magic to perform stunts and tricks that are impossible for regular people. Nothing beats the feel of wind in your hair, except maybe the intense purr of a finely tuned engine augmented by sorcery. You love pushing yourself (and your vehicle) to the limit, even if it’s dangerous—better to die a legend than live a long, dull life driving something boring. You enjoy drawing attention to yourself, so you tend to wear sleek clothing, stylish sunglasses, and borderline-gaudy jewelry, but never anything that interferes with your ability to control a car or cast a spell.
trans-unit.target: Your skill behind the wheel is legendary, combining natural talent and specialized magic to perform stunts and tricks that are impossible for regular people. Nothing beats the feel of wind in your hair, except maybe the intense purr of a finely tuned engine augmented by sorcery. You love pushing yourself (and your vehicle) to the limit, even if it’s dangerous—better to die a legend than live a long, dull life driving something boring. You enjoy drawing attention to yourself, so you tend to wear sleek clothing, stylish sunglasses, and borderline-gaudy jewelry, but never anything that interferes with your ability to control a car or cast a spell.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. To repay a favor they did for you a while ago, you promised to drive them somewhere. They haven’t taken you up on it yet.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. To repay a favor they did for you a while ago, you promised to drive them somewhere. They haven’t taken you up on it yet.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You were the getaway driver for them once in the past— perhaps for something criminal, a car stunt for a viral video, or to avoid a bad situation.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You were the getaway driver for them once in the past— perhaps for something criminal, a car stunt for a viral video, or to avoid a bad situation.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You know they were once in a very bad car collision that left the vehicle a wreck, but they somehow weren’t hurt at all.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You know they were once in a very bad car collision that left the vehicle a wreck, but they somehow weren’t hurt at all.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. They used to associate with someone who was trying to hunt you down, but they haven’t been in contact with that person in a while.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. They used to associate with someone who was trying to hunt you down, but they haven’t been in contact with that person in a while.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: A reasonably fast car.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: A reasonably fast car.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: The foe you hit (with your spell or car) is moved horizontally an immediate distance in a direction of your choice. Major Effect Suggestion: The foe is knocked prone and loses their next action.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: The foe you hit (with your spell or car) is moved horizontally an immediate distance in a direction of your choice. Major Effect Suggestion: The foe is knocked prone and loses their next action.

trans-unit.source: One Hand on the Wheel: As an action, you can cast a one-action spell and attempt a driving task. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: One Hand on the Wheel: As an action, you can cast a one-action spell and attempt a driving task. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Car Magic (3+ Intellect points): You can alter a magical ability you cast so it also affects the vehicle you’re driving, as if it were a part of you. For example, if you’re driving and you cast Hover on yourself, you and the car begin to float; if you cast Invisibility on yourself, you and the car turn invisible. Spells cast on a car this way tend to last only a few rounds before expiring (although the spell still lasts its full duration on you). The cost of Car Magic is added to the cost of the spell you’re casting. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can use Effort to affect other creatures within the car; each level of Effort used in this way affects up to two additional creatures in the car. Enabler. The main reason to cast Hover on a moving car is to make awesome-looking jumps that would be impossible without ramps, magic, or Hollywood special effects.
trans-unit.target: Car Magic (3+ Intellect points): You can alter a magical ability you cast so it also affects the vehicle you’re driving, as if it were a part of you. For example, if you’re driving and you cast Hover on yourself, you and the car begin to float; if you cast Invisibility on yourself, you and the car turn invisible. Spells cast on a car this way tend to last only a few rounds before expiring (although the spell still lasts its full duration on you). The cost of Car Magic is added to the cost of the spell you’re casting. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can use Effort to affect other creatures within the car; each level of Effort used in this way affects up to two additional creatures in the car. Enabler. The main reason to cast Hover on a moving car is to make awesome-looking jumps that would be impossible without ramps, magic, or Hollywood special effects.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Expert Driver or Perfect Parking Space as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Expert Driver or Perfect Parking Space as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: 1Perfect Parking Space (3 Intellect points): You can send your car into a pocket dimension that moves with you and is just large enough to hold it. Nobody other than you can perceive or access this space unless they have the ability to interact with transdimensional areas. The space is a part of you, so you can’t use it to store the car if you and the car have more cyphers than your limit, a detonation cypher activated inside the car while it’s in the space harms you, and so on. Storing or retrieving the car happens over one minute as it slowly (and visibly) vanishes or reappears; you can reduce this time to just one round if you succeed at a level 4 Intellect task. Action to initiate.
trans-unit.target: 1Perfect Parking Space (3 Intellect points): You can send your car into a pocket dimension that moves with you and is just large enough to hold it. Nobody other than you can perceive or access this space unless they have the ability to interact with transdimensional areas. The space is a part of you, so you can’t use it to store the car if you and the car have more cyphers than your limit, a detonation cypher activated inside the car while it’s in the space harms you, and so on. Storing or retrieving the car happens over one minute as it slowly (and visibly) vanishes or reappears; you can reduce this time to just one round if you succeed at a level 4 Intellect task. Action to initiate.

trans-unit.source: Deer in the Headlights: When you cast an attack spell while driving, you can modify the spell as if you had applied two levels of Intellect Effort to it. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Deer in the Headlights: When you cast an attack spell while driving, you can modify the spell as if you had applied two levels of Intellect Effort to it. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Spells Have No Speed Limit or Trick Driver as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Spells Have No Speed Limit or Trick Driver as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Spells Have No Speed Limit: Any car you have driven for at least a minute responds to you like a well-trained robot, allowing you to mentally give it orders from a long distance away. This control includes any aspect of driving the car (such as steering, accelerating, and braking) and any moveable parts on the car (such as opening or closing the doors, hood, or trunk). The car takes actions on your turn, and you make rolls for it in combat or when it takes actions. You can only control one car at a time with this ability (although you could manually drive one car and magically control another car at the same time). If you are driving the car you’re controlling with this ability, your driving tasks and extreme tricks with the car (such as jumping a ravine or other vehicle, spinning in the air, landing safely on another vehicle, and so on) are eased. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Spells Have No Speed Limit: Any car you have driven for at least a minute responds to you like a well-trained robot, allowing you to mentally give it orders from a long distance away. This control includes any aspect of driving the car (such as steering, accelerating, and braking) and any moveable parts on the car (such as opening or closing the doors, hood, or trunk). The car takes actions on your turn, and you make rolls for it in combat or when it takes actions. You can only control one car at a time with this ability (although you could manually drive one car and magically control another car at the same time). If you are driving the car you’re controlling with this ability, your driving tasks and extreme tricks with the car (such as jumping a ravine or other vehicle, spinning in the air, landing safely on another vehicle, and so on) are eased. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Magic comes intuitively to some people, but you’ve always had to work a bit harder. Luckily, you find that research comes naturally. You know what questions to ask; you know which books, websites, or professionals will have the answers. You spent years studying and practicing, and you taught yourself everything you know. Now you’re a skilled magician who’s always eager to learn more—evidenced by your lengthy reading list.
trans-unit.target: Magic comes intuitively to some people, but you’ve always had to work a bit harder. Luckily, you find that research comes naturally. You know what questions to ask; you know which books, websites, or professionals will have the answers. You spent years studying and practicing, and you taught yourself everything you know. Now you’re a skilled magician who’s always eager to learn more—evidenced by your lengthy reading list.

trans-unit.source: Connection: Choose one of the following or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: Connection: Choose one of the following or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. They appreciate (but do not necessarily share) your obsession with books, libraries, and research.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. They appreciate (but do not necessarily share) your obsession with books, libraries, and research.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You once owed this character a lot of money (or vice versa), although that debt is now paid.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You once owed this character a lot of money (or vice versa), although that debt is now paid.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. They remind you about an obscure author whose books you enjoy, and you can’t help but like them.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. They remind you about an obscure author whose books you enjoy, and you can’t help but like them.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You think this person is woefully ignorant about a lot of important topics (history, magic, ethics, and so on).
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You think this person is woefully ignorant about a lot of important topics (history, magic, ethics, and so on).

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: You gain a burst of insight, easing your next action by one step. Major Effect Suggestion: Your knowledge lets you tap into an obscure current of magic and make a free recovery roll as part of your current action.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: You gain a burst of insight, easing your next action by one step. Major Effect Suggestion: Your knowledge lets you tap into an obscure current of magic and make a free recovery roll as part of your current action.

trans-unit.source: Library Life: When a problem needs solving, you may not know the solution, but you know where to look. You are trained in research. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Library Life: When a problem needs solving, you may not know the solution, but you know where to look. You are trained in research. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Enhanced Intellect Edge or Repeated Rituals as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Enhanced Intellect Edge or Repeated Rituals as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Repeated Rituals: If you’ve successfully completed a ritual in the past, tasks for performing that ritual again are eased by two steps. Enabler
trans-unit.target: Repeated Rituals: If you’ve successfully completed a ritual in the past, tasks for performing that ritual again are eased by two steps. Enabler

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Greater Enhanced Intellect or Mental Magic as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Greater Enhanced Intellect or Mental Magic as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Mental Magic: When attempting a magic-based Might or Speed task, you can instead roll as if it were an Intellect action. This means that if you apply Effort, you spend points from your Intellect Pool and use your Intellect Edge. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Mental Magic: When attempting a magic-based Might or Speed task, you can instead roll as if it were an Intellect action. This means that if you apply Effort, you spend points from your Intellect Pool and use your Intellect Edge. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: The moon is a powerful force on the world, in terms of both science and magic. She hangs overhead like a watchful eye, makes creatures act strangely, represents cycles of time, and causes the ebb and flow of the tides.
