Any creature whose level is less than the cypher level can’t use these methods to get in or out. Player characters using such abilities must succeed at an Intellect-based task with a difficulty equal to the cypher level in order to enter or leave the area. The block lasts for one day per cypher level.
trans-unit.target: Effect: A short area within immediate range of the user becomes warded against any teleportation effect or other ability that allows travel without direct physical movement (including abilities specifically meant to get around obstacles, such as Bypass Barrier). Any creature whose level is less than the cypher level can’t use these methods to get in or out. Player characters using such abilities must succeed at an Intellect-based task with a difficulty equal to the cypher level in order to enter or leave the area. The block lasts for one day per cypher level.

trans-unit.source: Effect: The user chooses any window they can see, and they are able to look through it as if they were standing right in front of it. The window does not need to be transparent, the user does not need to stay in sight of the window after they choose it, and no one else can perceive what they’re doing. While they are looking through the window, they can wink to change their vision back to their current location, then wink again to return to the window. The effect lasts for ten minutes per cypher level or until they choose to end it.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The user chooses any window they can see, and they are able to look through it as if they were standing right in front of it. The window does not need to be transparent, the user does not need to stay in sight of the window after they choose it, and no one else can perceive what they’re doing. While they are looking through the window, they can wink to change their vision back to their current location, then wink again to return to the window. The effect lasts for ten minutes per cypher level or until they choose to end it.

trans-unit.source: Form: Bus ticket, moss, remote control
trans-unit.target: Form: Bus ticket, moss, remote control

trans-unit.source: Effect: For the next day, no matter what time the user leaves or what hurdles they encounter, they will arrive exactly on time for the event, ride, or other activity. Busses and planes will not leave without them, the play or movie will not start until they arrive, and they’ll meet people exactly when they said they would. (Note that this doesn’t change how the user gets there— they may still sit in traffic forever or get stuck in the security line.) Their traveling companions, if any, enjoy the same benefit as long as they stick with the user.
trans-unit.target: Effect: For the next day, no matter what time the user leaves or what hurdles they encounter, they will arrive exactly on time for the event, ride, or other activity. Busses and planes will not leave without them, the play or movie will not start until they arrive, and they’ll meet people exactly when they said they would. (Note that this doesn’t change how the user gets there— they may still sit in traffic forever or get stuck in the security line.) Their traveling companions, if any, enjoy the same benefit as long as they stick with the user.

trans-unit.source: Effect: When activated, it turns the wearer into a liquid or gaseous form of themselves, allowing them to travel through small spaces, such as air ducts, sewer tunnels, tight caverns, and so on. Efforts to detect the user are hindered by two steps (or three steps if the cypher is level 5 or higher), even by magic or security systems. The spaces must be at least 1 foot (30 cm) in diameter and must not be blocked by rocks, doors, and so on. The effect lasts for ten minutes per cypher level.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When activated, it turns the wearer into a liquid or gaseous form of themselves, allowing them to travel through small spaces, such as air ducts, sewer tunnels, tight caverns, and so on. Efforts to detect the user are hindered by two steps (or three steps if the cypher is level 5 or higher), even by magic or security systems. The spaces must be at least 1 foot (30 cm) in diameter and must not be blocked by rocks, doors, and so on. The effect lasts for ten minutes per cypher level.

trans-unit.source: Effect: Restores a number of points equal to the cypher level to the user’s choice of Pools. In addition, the user adds +3 to their next recovery roll.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Restores a number of points equal to the cypher level to the user’s choice of Pools. In addition, the user adds +3 to their next recovery roll.

trans-unit.source: Form: Remote control, glass eye, stone with a hole
trans-unit.target: Form: Remote control, glass eye, stone with a hole

trans-unit.source: Effect: For the next ten minutes per cypher level, the cypher vibrates any time the user is being monitored, watched, or tracked by something of the cypher level or less. This includes people, devices, security systems, cameras, spells, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Effect: For the next ten minutes per cypher level, the cypher vibrates any time the user is being monitored, watched, or tracked by something of the cypher level or less. This includes people, devices, security systems, cameras, spells, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Form: Wire, broken electronics, phone charger
trans-unit.target: Form: Wire, broken electronics, phone charger

trans-unit.source: Effect: Activating the cypher creates a large wraithlike being that looks as if it’s formed from wire. The wraith is a level 4 incorporeal construct that inflicts 4 points of electrical damage (ignores Armor) with its touch when directed. While the construct persists, the user can use it to slip through small areas, carry an electrical current, or attack foes. It lasts for a number of rounds equal to the cypher level.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Activating the cypher creates a large wraithlike being that looks as if it’s formed from wire. The wraith is a level 4 incorporeal construct that inflicts 4 points of electrical damage (ignores Armor) with its touch when directed. While the construct persists, the user can use it to slip through small areas, carry an electrical current, or attack foes. It lasts for a number of rounds equal to the cypher level.

trans-unit.source: Effect: When thrown, the ball multiplies into a number of itself equal to the cypher level. Each ball bounces once and then slams into targets within long range chosen by the user. The impact of each ball does 2 points of ambient damage (ignores Armor). If the same foe is hit by two or more balls, they are also knocked prone for one round.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When thrown, the ball multiplies into a number of itself equal to the cypher level. Each ball bounces once and then slams into targets within long range chosen by the user. The impact of each ball does 2 points of ambient damage (ignores Armor). If the same foe is hit by two or more balls, they are also knocked prone for one round.

trans-unit.source: Effect: Once the user activates the cypher, it protects them from ambient damage. The next time they would take ambient damage, such as from falling off a roof or being electrocuted by a power line, the cypher absorbs all of the damage (up to the cypher level).
trans-unit.target: Effect: Once the user activates the cypher, it protects them from ambient damage. The next time they would take ambient damage, such as from falling off a roof or being electrocuted by a power line, the cypher absorbs all of the damage (up to the cypher level).

trans-unit.source: Effect: Adds +1 to the user’s Intellect Edge (+2 for cypher level 5 or higher) for the next 24 hours, but only for the purpose of casting spells.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Adds +1 to the user’s Intellect Edge (+2 for cypher level 5 or higher) for the next 24 hours, but only for the purpose of casting spells.

trans-unit.source: When the cypher is activated, the user attracts the attention of a malevolent internet d@emon, who slides into their internet-connected devices and starts draining their magic. The d@emon remains even after the cypher’s duration expires.
trans-unit.target: When the cypher is activated, the user attracts the attention of a malevolent internet d@emon, who slides into their internet-connected devices and starts draining their magic. The d@emon remains even after the cypher’s duration expires.

trans-unit.source: EasyMagic.app has a beneficial effect, but also a serious drawback—it attracts a hostile creature to prey upon the user’s magic. The cypher is significantly better than a typical Edge-augmenting cypher like an Intellect booster (lasting 24 hours instead of one hour) in order to trick a naive or greedy character into activating it. Magicians well-versed in cypher lore (and human nature) recognize that this sort of thing is too good to be true.
trans-unit.target: EasyMagic.app has a beneficial effect, but also a serious drawback—it attracts a hostile creature to prey upon the user’s magic. The cypher is significantly better than a typical Edge-augmenting cypher like an Intellect booster (lasting 24 hours instead of one hour) in order to trick a naive or greedy character into activating it. Magicians well-versed in cypher lore (and human nature) recognize that this sort of thing is too good to be true.

trans-unit.source: The GM should feel free to create similar kinds of malware app cyphers that are somewhat better than the standard ones in this chapter or in the Cypher System Rulebook, and give them a harmful side effect. Example malware cypher benefits are curatives that add more points or affect two Pools at once, Effort enhancers that can be used two or more times in an hour, and perfections that don’t require an action to activate (and therefore can affect a roll on the same turn the user activates the cypher).
trans-unit.target: The GM should feel free to create similar kinds of malware app cyphers that are somewhat better than the standard ones in this chapter or in the Cypher System Rulebook, and give them a harmful side effect. Example malware cypher benefits are curatives that add more points or affect two Pools at once, Effort enhancers that can be used two or more times in an hour, and perfections that don’t require an action to activate (and therefore can affect a roll on the same turn the user activates the cypher).

trans-unit.source: Example malware cypher drawbacks are hindering the user’s attack spells, debiting the user’s bank account, monitoring the user’s in-person or magical communications, deleting the user’s other magical app cyphers, compelling the user to take a specific action, “locking” one of the user’s spells until they pay a ransom, accessing private data such as passwords or photos, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Example malware cypher drawbacks are hindering the user’s attack spells, debiting the user’s bank account, monitoring the user’s in-person or magical communications, deleting the user’s other magical app cyphers, compelling the user to take a specific action, “locking” one of the user’s spells until they pay a ransom, accessing private data such as passwords or photos, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Other common malware cypher names are WarlockAntivirus, SpellManager, HexCleaner, TomeBot, and ScryBlocker.
trans-unit.target: Other common malware cypher names are WarlockAntivirus, SpellManager, HexCleaner, TomeBot, and ScryBlocker.

trans-unit.source: If cyphers are the expendable magic that is ever-present in fantasy, artifacts are the more durable magic items that can be used over and over again—tomes of weird magic, magical vehicles, and so on. Unlike cyphers, there is no limit to how many artifacts a character can bear.
trans-unit.target: If cyphers are the expendable magic that is ever-present in fantasy, artifacts are the more durable magic items that can be used over and over again—tomes of weird magic, magical vehicles, and so on. Unlike cyphers, there is no limit to how many artifacts a character can bear.

trans-unit.source: Pearls of your grandmother, the witch
trans-unit.target: Pearls of your grandmother, the witch

trans-unit.source: Artifacts are more powerful than common equipment or cyphers.
trans-unit.target: Artifacts are more powerful than common equipment or cyphers.

trans-unit.source: Each artifact has a level and a rate of power depletion. When an artifact is used or activated, the player rolls the designated die (1d6, 1d10, 1d20, or 1d00). If the die shows the depletion number(s), the item works, but that is its last use. A depletion entry of “—” means that the artifact never depletes, and an entry of “automatic” means that it can be used only once.
trans-unit.target: Each artifact has a level and a rate of power depletion. When an artifact is used or activated, the player rolls the designated die (1d6, 1d10, 1d20, or 1d00). If the die shows the depletion number(s), the item works, but that is its last use. A depletion entry of “—” means that the artifact never depletes, and an entry of “automatic” means that it can be used only once.

trans-unit.source: Depowered artifacts can sometimes be recharged using the repair rules, depending on the item’s nature. Other special abilities can also repower an expended item, but probably for only one use. Powerful magical creatures might be able to recharge artifacts, at least temporarily.
trans-unit.target: Depowered artifacts can sometimes be recharged using the repair rules, depending on the item’s nature. Other special abilities can also repower an expended item, but probably for only one use. Powerful magical creatures might be able to recharge artifacts, at least temporarily.

trans-unit.source: Form: Articulated action figure that comes equipped with a number of accessories, such as a gun, armor, handbag, laptop computer, dazzling outfit, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Form: Articulated action figure that comes equipped with a number of accessories, such as a gun, armor, handbag, laptop computer, dazzling outfit, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Effect: The action figure carries a number of accessories equal to the artifact level. When the button on their back is pushed, the action figure does nothing, but their accessories grow to the size they would be if they were real, and they become functional. They remain this way for a day.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The action figure carries a number of accessories equal to the artifact level. When the button on their back is pushed, the action figure does nothing, but their accessories grow to the size they would be if they were real, and they become functional. They remain this way for a day.

trans-unit.source: Roll a d20 for each accessory the action figure might carry.
trans-unit.target: Roll a d20 for each accessory the action figure might carry.

trans-unit.source: Handbag (includes a handful of items, such as gum, lipstick, sunglasses, and a notebook)
trans-unit.target: Handbag (includes a handful of items, such as gum, lipstick, sunglasses, and a notebook)

trans-unit.source: Form: Magic billiard ball fill with liquid, inside of which a small gargoyle, crow, or other creature floats
trans-unit.target: Form: Magic billiard ball fill with liquid, inside of which a small gargoyle, crow, or other creature floats

trans-unit.source: Effect: The user can shake the magic ball, causing the creature inside to wake up. They can ask the creature two questions about the future and learn the answer (three questions if the artifact is level 4 or higher, four questions if the artifact is level 6 or higher). Because the future is ever-changing, the answers may not line up perfectly with what will happen, but they usually offer at least one piece of concrete, actionable information.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The user can shake the magic ball, causing the creature inside to wake up. They can ask the creature two questions about the future and learn the answer (three questions if the artifact is level 4 or higher, four questions if the artifact is level 6 or higher). Because the future is ever-changing, the answers may not line up perfectly with what will happen, but they usually offer at least one piece of concrete, actionable information.

trans-unit.source: Form: Metal and glass card about the size and shape of a library card
trans-unit.target: Form: Metal and glass card about the size and shape of a library card

trans-unit.source: Effect: Allows the user to “borrow” people’s minds the same way that one might borrow a library book. The person must be agreeable to sharing their knowledge and must be within short range of the user when the exchange happens. For the next 24 hours, the user has access to the person’s brain from anywhere, allowing them to become trained in two noncombat skills or specialized in one noncombat skill. The skill they choose must make sense for the person whose brain they’re “borrowing” (for example, a professor of English lit would likely be skilled in speed-reading and storytelling, but maybe not in woodworking or cooking). They can only borrow one person’s mind each day.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Allows the user to “borrow” people’s minds the same way that one might borrow a library book. The person must be agreeable to sharing their knowledge and must be within short range of the user when the exchange happens. For the next 24 hours, the user has access to the person’s brain from anywhere, allowing them to become trained in two noncombat skills or specialized in one noncombat skill. The skill they choose must make sense for the person whose brain they’re “borrowing” (for example, a professor of English lit would likely be skilled in speed-reading and storytelling, but maybe not in woodworking or cooking). They can only borrow one person’s mind each day.

trans-unit.source: Form: Tattoo of a flock of crows located anywhere on the body
trans-unit.target: Form: Tattoo of a flock of crows located anywhere on the body

trans-unit.source: Effect: When the tattoo is activated, the crows fly out of it in a barrage of attacks. Everyone and everything in an immediate area suffers damage equal to the artifact level, unless they are designated safe by the user ahead of time.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When the tattoo is activated, the crows fly out of it in a barrage of attacks. Everyone and everything in an immediate area suffers damage equal to the artifact level, unless they are designated safe by the user ahead of time.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d6 (when the artifact depletes, the tattoo flies away and disappears)
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d6 (when the artifact depletes, the tattoo flies away and disappears)

trans-unit.source: Form: Small metal pipe that’s been etched with elaborate symbols
trans-unit.target: Form: Small metal pipe that’s been etched with elaborate symbols

trans-unit.source: Effect: After killing a magical creature, the user can place the pipe against the body and suck the creature’s magic up into their body. The creature must have been slain by the user, they must be magical in some way, and they must have died within the last hour. The user restores a number of points equal to the artifact level to their Intellect Pool (even if this temporarily puts them above their maximum Pool).
trans-unit.target: Effect: After killing a magical creature, the user can place the pipe against the body and suck the creature’s magic up into their body. The creature must have been slain by the user, they must be magical in some way, and they must have died within the last hour. The user restores a number of points equal to the artifact level to their Intellect Pool (even if this temporarily puts them above their maximum Pool).

trans-unit.source: Form: Handcrafted sword etched with vines and roses
trans-unit.target: Form: Handcrafted sword etched with vines and roses

trans-unit.source: Effect: This sword is a medium weapon that inflicts 5 points of damage (6 points if the artifact is level 6 or higher). Additionally, on the first successful attack against a foe, the sword sows a rose vine into the creature’s heart. The vine begins to spread through the creature’s veins, inflicting 2 additional points of damage each round for one day or until magic is used to remove the vine. A PC can end the effect early by succeeding on a Might defense roll on their turn.
trans-unit.target: Effect: This sword is a medium weapon that inflicts 5 points of damage (6 points if the artifact is level 6 or higher). Additionally, on the first successful attack against a foe, the sword sows a rose vine into the creature’s heart. The vine begins to spread through the creature’s veins, inflicting 2 additional points of damage each round for one day or until magic is used to remove the vine. A PC can end the effect early by succeeding on a Might defense roll on their turn.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d00 (check each first successful attack)
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d00 (check each first successful attack)

trans-unit.source: Form: Pocket-sized book with a well-worn leather cover filled with handwritten recipes
trans-unit.target: Form: Pocket-sized book with a well-worn leather cover filled with handwritten recipes

trans-unit.source: Effect: Taking a round to read a recipe from the book aloud causes everyone within short range to feel as if they’ve eaten the meal from the recipe. They all add +1 to their recovery rolls for the next ten minutes.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Taking a round to read a recipe from the book aloud causes everyone within short range to feel as if they’ve eaten the meal from the recipe. They all add +1 to their recovery rolls for the next ten minutes.

trans-unit.source: Form: Backpack, purse, or duffel covered in patches
trans-unit.target: Form: Backpack, purse, or duffel covered in patches

trans-unit.source: Effect: This bag can hold a number of magic items (including cyphers and artifacts) equal to the artifact level. Every item the user places inside the bag instantly turns into a patch on the bag’s surface. Only the user can recognize these patches as the objects they once were, and only the user can turn them back into their original items (doing so takes an action). The bag can also be used as a regular bag to hold mundane items, which does not affect how many magic items it can hold. Cyphers in the bag do not count against the user’s cypher limit.
trans-unit.target: Effect: This bag can hold a number of magic items (including cyphers and artifacts) equal to the artifact level. Every item the user places inside the bag instantly turns into a patch on the bag’s surface. Only the user can recognize these patches as the objects they once were, and only the user can turn them back into their original items (doing so takes an action). The bag can also be used as a regular bag to hold mundane items, which does not affect how many magic items it can hold. Cyphers in the bag do not count against the user’s cypher limit.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (roll each time a magic item is added)
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (roll each time a magic item is added)

trans-unit.source: Form: Small wooden box with a remote opener
trans-unit.target: Form: Small wooden box with a remote opener

trans-unit.source: Effect: Opening the box reveals a dazzling array of enticing things to do, see, hear, and experience. These enticements are magically geared to those experiencing them. Everyone who fails an Intellect defense roll within short range of the box is so distracted that they’re hindered on all actions for a number of rounds equal to the artifact level. (NPCs whose level is less than the artifact level are automatically affected.) The remote will open and close the box from up to long range away.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Opening the box reveals a dazzling array of enticing things to do, see, hear, and experience. These enticements are magically geared to those experiencing them. Everyone who fails an Intellect defense roll within short range of the box is so distracted that they’re hindered on all actions for a number of rounds equal to the artifact level. (NPCs whose level is less than the artifact level are automatically affected.) The remote will open and close the box from up to long range away.

trans-unit.source: Form: Onyx ring that depicts a cat curling around itself, so that it becomes a feline ouroboros
trans-unit.target: Form: Onyx ring that depicts a cat curling around itself, so that it becomes a feline ouroboros

trans-unit.source: Effect: The ring allows the user to slink into the shadows, hide their true motives, and otherwise go mostly unseen and unnoticed. This provides an asset to sneaking, lockpicking, disguise, and deception tasks.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The ring allows the user to slink into the shadows, hide their true motives, and otherwise go mostly unseen and unnoticed. This provides an asset to sneaking, lockpicking, disguise, and deception tasks.

trans-unit.source: Form: Palm-sized device with a carabiner attached
trans-unit.target: Form: Palm-sized device with a carabiner attached

trans-unit.source: Effect: Stores up to five cypher apps at a time. The device is thumbprint-protected by the user, and only the user can add apps and activate them. Any additional apps stored above the user’s cypher limit do not count against the limit.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Stores up to five cypher apps at a time. The device is thumbprint-protected by the user, and only the user can add apps and activate them. Any additional apps stored above the user’s cypher limit do not count against the limit.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (check each time an app is added)
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (check each time an app is added)

trans-unit.source: Form: Ring that alters to perfectly fit the wearer (in size and appearance)
trans-unit.target: Form: Ring that alters to perfectly fit the wearer (in size and appearance)

trans-unit.source: Effect: Allows the user to copy a cypher app from any device the user chooses within long range. The ring chooses randomly from the available apps on that device, and the user doesn’t know what the app is until they receive it. They can activate the cypher app directly from the ring or download it into a device of their choice. The ring can only hold one app at a time, and that app does count against the user’s cypher limit.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Allows the user to copy a cypher app from any device the user chooses within long range. The ring chooses randomly from the available apps on that device, and the user doesn’t know what the app is until they receive it. They can activate the cypher app directly from the ring or download it into a device of their choice. The ring can only hold one app at a time, and that app does count against the user’s cypher limit.

trans-unit.source: Form: Can of spray paint modified to spray from three different nozzles
trans-unit.target: Form: Can of spray paint modified to spray from three different nozzles

trans-unit.source: Effect: Depending on which nozzle is used, the color cannon has the following effects with a successful attack roll by the user.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Depending on which nozzle is used, the color cannon has the following effects with a successful attack roll by the user.

trans-unit.source: Fear. Sprays a target within short range with a beam of color that frightens them so badly that they flee for a number of rounds equal to the artifact level.
trans-unit.target: Fear. Sprays a target within short range with a beam of color that frightens them so badly that they flee for a number of rounds equal to the artifact level.

trans-unit.source: Stun. Sprays a target within short range with a beam of color that stuns them for one round, making them lose their next action.
trans-unit.target: Stun. Sprays a target within short range with a beam of color that stuns them for one round, making them lose their next action.

trans-unit.source: Tag. Tags a target within long range with a symbol. All tasks involving tracking, following, and finding that target are eased for the next day. No matter where the symbol lands, the tag still works (for example, if the target’s shirt is tagged, the tag works even if they remove their shirt).
trans-unit.target: Tag. Tags a target within long range with a symbol. All tasks involving tracking, following, and finding that target are eased for the next day. No matter where the symbol lands, the tag still works (for example, if the target’s shirt is tagged, the tag works even if they remove their shirt).

trans-unit.source: Effect: The glasses analyze a foe and display information about the best places to strike them as well as how best to avoid their incoming attacks. If the user spends an action to allow the glasses to analyze a chosen foe, they gain an asset in both melee attacks and Speed defense rolls against the foe. They must take a separate action to analyze each foe, and the glasses can only assist against one foe at a time.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The glasses analyze a foe and display information about the best places to strike them as well as how best to avoid their incoming attacks. If the user spends an action to allow the glasses to analyze a chosen foe, they gain an asset in both melee attacks and Speed defense rolls against the foe. They must take a separate action to analyze each foe, and the glasses can only assist against one foe at a time.

trans-unit.source: Form: Pocket-sized figurine of a crow, its feathers worn from being lovingly petted over time
trans-unit.target: Form: Pocket-sized figurine of a crow, its feathers worn from being lovingly petted over time

trans-unit.source: Effect: For as long as the user carries the figurine on their person and does not actively harm, scare, or otherwise offend any living corvids, a flock of crows may show up randomly once per day to assist them. The crows arrive on their own time and act as crows do, attempting to help the user in the way that they deem most useful, such as dropping stones on a foe’s head, warning them of incoming dangers, bringing them a snack, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Effect: For as long as the user carries the figurine on their person and does not actively harm, scare, or otherwise offend any living corvids, a flock of crows may show up randomly once per day to assist them. The crows arrive on their own time and act as crows do, attempting to help the user in the way that they deem most useful, such as dropping stones on a foe’s head, warning them of incoming dangers, bringing them a snack, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d00 (roll each time the crows arrive)
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d00 (roll each time the crows arrive)

trans-unit.source: Form: Pair of over-the-ear headphones that sparkle in the light
trans-unit.target: Form: Pair of over-the-ear headphones that sparkle in the light

trans-unit.source: Effect: When worn, the headphones provide the user with an enhanced sense of elegance, power, or status. Other people find themselves drawn to the user in the hopes of helping them, granting their wishes, and treating them like the royalty they obviously are. All social interactions are eased.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When worn, the headphones provide the user with an enhanced sense of elegance, power, or status. Other people find themselves drawn to the user in the hopes of helping them, granting their wishes, and treating them like the royalty they obviously are. All social interactions are eased.

trans-unit.source: Form: Quill made from a green feather
trans-unit.target: Form: Quill made from a green feather

trans-unit.source: Effect: The user can dip the pen in ink and draw an object or creature, which becomes real for one minute. The object or creature’s level is half the artifact’s level, +1 level if the user is trained in drawing, or +2 levels if the user is specialized in drawing. Once released from the page or surface it was drawn upon, the object or creature swells until it reaches the appropriate size, but it grows no bigger than an immediate distance in width, depth, and height. If a creature is made, it does the bidding of the user.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The user can dip the pen in ink and draw an object or creature, which becomes real for one minute. The object or creature’s level is half the artifact’s level, +1 level if the user is trained in drawing, or +2 levels if the user is specialized in drawing. Once released from the page or surface it was drawn upon, the object or creature swells until it reaches the appropriate size, but it grows no bigger than an immediate distance in width, depth, and height. If a creature is made, it does the bidding of the user.

trans-unit.source: Someone familiar with magic made from drawings or illustrations, such as someone who has the Inks Spells on Skin focus, can use the pen as part of casting their spells, easing the task of casting the spell.
trans-unit.target: Someone familiar with magic made from drawings or illustrations, such as someone who has the Inks Spells on Skin focus, can use the pen as part of casting their spells, easing the task of casting the spell.

trans-unit.source: Form: Red crystal bottle filled with amber perfume
trans-unit.target: Form: Red crystal bottle filled with amber perfume

trans-unit.source: Effect: This perfume is specially created to be used by a single person. To activate it for the first time, the user must put a single drop of their blood into the bottle, incorporating their own scent into that of the perfume. The result smells amazing to them but is not noticeable to anyone else.
trans-unit.target: Effect: This perfume is specially created to be used by a single person. To activate it for the first time, the user must put a single drop of their blood into the bottle, incorporating their own scent into that of the perfume. The result smells amazing to them but is not noticeable to anyone else.

trans-unit.source: After that, whenever the user applies the perfume, it provides +2 Armor (+3 if the artifact is level 9 or higher). Each application lasts for ten minutes per artifact level, and it’s an action to reapply the perfume.
trans-unit.target: After that, whenever the user applies the perfume, it provides +2 Armor (+3 if the artifact is level 9 or higher). Each application lasts for ten minutes per artifact level, and it’s an action to reapply the perfume.

trans-unit.source: Anyone else who attempts to wear the perfume quickly realizes it smells awful on their skin, and they take 1 point of damage.
trans-unit.target: Anyone else who attempts to wear the perfume quickly realizes it smells awful on their skin, and they take 1 point of damage.

trans-unit.source: Form: Set of refrigerator magnets (two of each letter and two of each number 0 through 9) made out of bone or wood
trans-unit.target: Form: Set of refrigerator magnets (two of each letter and two of each number 0 through 9) made out of bone or wood

trans-unit.source: Effect: Ghosts, haunts, wraiths, poltergeists, and other spectral creatures can move these objects as easily as a human can, using them to spell out messages visible to anyone in the area. Usually, the magnets are also enchanted so these creatures can’t remove them from the surface they’re attached to (preventing the creatures from stealing, hiding, or throwing them).
trans-unit.target: Effect: Ghosts, haunts, wraiths, poltergeists, and other spectral creatures can move these objects as easily as a human can, using them to spell out messages visible to anyone in the area. Usually, the magnets are also enchanted so these creatures can’t remove them from the surface they’re attached to (preventing the creatures from stealing, hiding, or throwing them).

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (check each day of use); depletion means one of the magnets is lost forever but the remainder continue to function
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (check each day of use); depletion means one of the magnets is lost forever but the remainder continue to function

trans-unit.source: Form: Small woven rug, large enough for several people to sit on
trans-unit.target: Form: Small woven rug, large enough for several people to sit on

trans-unit.source: Effect: The carpet flies a long distance each round, carrying up to five passengers. It flies for up to ten hours per activation. When traveling overland, the artifact can achieve a flying speed of 60 miles (97 km) per hour.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The carpet flies a long distance each round, carrying up to five passengers. It flies for up to ten hours per activation. When traveling overland, the artifact can achieve a flying speed of 60 miles (97 km) per hour.

trans-unit.source: Form: Glass eye that shines with a beautiful inner light
trans-unit.target: Form: Glass eye that shines with a beautiful inner light

trans-unit.source: Effect: Looking through the glass eye allows the user to see anything that’s hidden or invisible, including magic, up to the level of the artifact. If they have the glass eye surgically or magically implanted (a task equal to the artifact level), they also gain an asset in using magic in all its forms, including crafting, combat, and defenses.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Looking through the glass eye allows the user to see anything that’s hidden or invisible, including magic, up to the level of the artifact. If they have the glass eye surgically or magically implanted (a task equal to the artifact level), they also gain an asset in using magic in all its forms, including crafting, combat, and defenses.

trans-unit.source: Form: Small lapel pin of a winged, grinning gargoyle
trans-unit.target: Form: Small lapel pin of a winged, grinning gargoyle

trans-unit.source: Effect: Once activated, this gargoyle grows to the size of a human. It follows within a few feet of the user and attacks anyone or anything within immediate range that attacks it or the user. The gargoyle attacks with a powerful blast of water that deals damage equal to its level. The gargoyle lasts for a day.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Once activated, this gargoyle grows to the size of a human. It follows within a few feet of the user and attacks anyone or anything within immediate range that attacks it or the user. The gargoyle attacks with a powerful blast of water that deals damage equal to its level. The gargoyle lasts for a day.

trans-unit.source: Form: Long black blade with a carved stone handle
trans-unit.target: Form: Long black blade with a carved stone handle

trans-unit.source: Effect: A successful attack with the blade doesn’t inflict physical damage. Instead, it fills the foe’s mind with dark and dangerous thoughts, inflicting 4 points of Intellect damage (6 points if the artifact Is level 5 or higher) that ignore Armor. The foe does not need to be corporeal for the attack to be successful.
trans-unit.target: Effect: A successful attack with the blade doesn’t inflict physical damage. Instead, it fills the foe’s mind with dark and dangerous thoughts, inflicting 4 points of Intellect damage (6 points if the artifact Is level 5 or higher) that ignore Armor. The foe does not need to be corporeal for the attack to be successful.

trans-unit.source: Form: Watch with a beautiful leather band and silver face whose hands and numbers move in a seemingly random order
trans-unit.target: Form: Watch with a beautiful leather band and silver face whose hands and numbers move in a seemingly random order

trans-unit.source: Effect: The watch works as a two-way communication device to someone in the past whose level is equal to or less than the artifact level. A screen opens up on the watch face that allows the user to see the person and interact with them. The person isn’t compelled to interact with the user, and the user’s interaction with them doesn’t change anything in the present or future. The connection stays open for ten minutes per artifact level.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The watch works as a two-way communication device to someone in the past whose level is equal to or less than the artifact level. A screen opens up on the watch face that allows the user to see the person and interact with them. The person isn’t compelled to interact with the user, and the user’s interaction with them doesn’t change anything in the present or future. The connection stays open for ten minutes per artifact level.

trans-unit.source: Form: Two small gold keys, each with a simple bow
trans-unit.target: Form: Two small gold keys, each with a simple bow

trans-unit.source: Effect: When activated by two people standing together, the bows of the keys magically adjust to create an abstract representation of the two users’ relationship. At any time, one of the users can teleport themselves to the other person instantly, from up to 50 miles (80 km) away. For this to work, both people must have their key on their person, and there must be no magical barriers in place that are higher level than the artifact.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When activated by two people standing together, the bows of the keys magically adjust to create an abstract representation of the two users’ relationship. At any time, one of the users can teleport themselves to the other person instantly, from up to 50 miles (80 km) away. For this to work, both people must have their key on their person, and there must be no magical barriers in place that are higher level than the artifact.

trans-unit.source: Form: Collection of metal magnets in a small tin
trans-unit.target: Form: Collection of metal magnets in a small tin

trans-unit.source: Effect: If the user spends about an hour shaping the metal magnets into a copy of a living entity they’ve seen or have an image of, such as a human, cat, or dragon, the living metal takes the shape of that entity (albeit at about a tenth of its size). The copycat does and says everything that the living entity is doing, at the moment that they’re doing it. The copycat lasts for ten minutes per artifact level, after which it returns to a collection of magnets.
trans-unit.target: Effect: If the user spends about an hour shaping the metal magnets into a copy of a living entity they’ve seen or have an image of, such as a human, cat, or dragon, the living metal takes the shape of that entity (albeit at about a tenth of its size). The copycat does and says everything that the living entity is doing, at the moment that they’re doing it. The copycat lasts for ten minutes per artifact level, after which it returns to a collection of magnets.

trans-unit.source: Form: Silver medallion bearing several magical symbols
trans-unit.target: Form: Silver medallion bearing several magical symbols

trans-unit.source: Effect: The wearer’s defense rolls against spell attacks are eased (by two steps if the artifact level is 7 or higher).
trans-unit.target: Effect: The wearer’s defense rolls against spell attacks are eased (by two steps if the artifact level is 7 or higher).

trans-unit.source: Form: Thumb drive with the image of a lamp engraved on it
trans-unit.target: Form: Thumb drive with the image of a lamp engraved on it

trans-unit.source: Effect: Inserting the thumb drive into a device produces the avatar of a genie who grants the user a single wish. The GM assigns a level to the wish, so the larger and more difficult the wish, the more difficult it is to have the wish granted. Generally, a wish such as gaining an asset or inexpensive item is level 1, and a wish for an expensive item or for a foe to vanish is level 7. The genie cannot grant a wish above its level. The genie can grant only one wish per day.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Inserting the thumb drive into a device produces the avatar of a genie who grants the user a single wish. The GM assigns a level to the wish, so the larger and more difficult the wish, the more difficult it is to have the wish granted. Generally, a wish such as gaining an asset or inexpensive item is level 1, and a wish for an expensive item or for a foe to vanish is level 7. The genie cannot grant a wish above its level. The genie can grant only one wish per day.

trans-unit.source: Form: Ring with a generic human face design
trans-unit.target: Form: Ring with a generic human face design

trans-unit.source: Effect: The ring creates a “meatboy,” a level 1 lifelike simulation of a human, who appears within immediate range. The meatboy has only a limited vocabulary and ability to reason. It does as the user instructs for one minute, then slumps, melts into reddish goo, and vanishes.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The ring creates a “meatboy,” a level 1 lifelike simulation of a human, who appears within immediate range. The meatboy has only a limited vocabulary and ability to reason. It does as the user instructs for one minute, then slumps, melts into reddish goo, and vanishes.

trans-unit.source: Form: Silver lapel pin in the shape of the Loch Ness monster
trans-unit.target: Form: Silver lapel pin in the shape of the Loch Ness monster

trans-unit.source: Effect: When activated, the back of the pin opens up to reveal a number of helpful miniature tools, including a lockpick, tweezers, screwdriver, and so on. Using the pin provides an asset in both magical and mundane tasks such as lockpicking and crafting. In addition, it allows the user to perceive items, creatures, spells, and doors that would normally be hidden by easing their perception tasks by two steps (three steps if the cypher is level 7 or higher).
trans-unit.target: Effect: When activated, the back of the pin opens up to reveal a number of helpful miniature tools, including a lockpick, tweezers, screwdriver, and so on. Using the pin provides an asset in both magical and mundane tasks such as lockpicking and crafting. In addition, it allows the user to perceive items, creatures, spells, and doors that would normally be hidden by easing their perception tasks by two steps (three steps if the cypher is level 7 or higher).

trans-unit.source: Pearls of Your Grandmother, the Witch
trans-unit.target: Pearls of Your Grandmother, the Witch

trans-unit.source: Form: Elegant necklace made of pearls with unusual colors and shapes
trans-unit.target: Form: Elegant necklace made of pearls with unusual colors and shapes

trans-unit.source: Effect: Wearing the necklace eases all crafting tasks (including crafting magic cyphers and artifacts). Tasks that involve finding, sourcing, locating, and purchasing craft-related items are also eased.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Wearing the necklace eases all crafting tasks (including crafting magic cyphers and artifacts). Tasks that involve finding, sourcing, locating, and purchasing craft-related items are also eased.

trans-unit.source: Form: Small metal lunchbox with an illustration of a person enjoying a picnic lunch
trans-unit.target: Form: Small metal lunchbox with an illustration of a person enjoying a picnic lunch

trans-unit.source: Effect: The lunchbox creates a set of sturdy compostable utensils and a compostable bowl filled to the brim with a bland-tasting porridge that provides enough nutrition for one person for one day (enough for two people if the artifact is level 5 or higher). The porridge is non-allergenic, gluten free, dairy free, meat free, and cruelty free.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The lunchbox creates a set of sturdy compostable utensils and a compostable bowl filled to the brim with a bland-tasting porridge that provides enough nutrition for one person for one day (enough for two people if the artifact is level 5 or higher). The porridge is non-allergenic, gluten free, dairy free, meat free, and cruelty free.

trans-unit.source: Form: Bright rainbow suspenders that adjust to fit the wearer perfectly
trans-unit.target: Form: Bright rainbow suspenders that adjust to fit the wearer perfectly

trans-unit.source: Effect: When worn and visible, the suspenders provide an asset to all positive social interactions. In addition, they provide +1 Armor against Intellect damage.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When worn and visible, the suspenders provide an asset to all positive social interactions. In addition, they provide +1 Armor against Intellect damage.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (roll each interaction); still wearable as regular suspenders after depletion
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (roll each interaction); still wearable as regular suspenders after depletion

trans-unit.source: Form: Red gold ring engraved with a chaotic bullet pattern
trans-unit.target: Form: Red gold ring engraved with a chaotic bullet pattern

trans-unit.source: Effect: When targeted with a ranged attack from a firearm that fires bullets, the wearer can attempt a hindered Speed defense roll. If the roll succeeds, the bullet rebounds before hitting the wearer and immediately returns to the sender, effectively granting the wearer a free attack against the shooter fired from the shooter’s weapon. The wearer is practiced with this attack.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When targeted with a ranged attack from a firearm that fires bullets, the wearer can attempt a hindered Speed defense roll. If the roll succeeds, the bullet rebounds before hitting the wearer and immediately returns to the sender, effectively granting the wearer a free attack against the shooter fired from the shooter’s weapon. The wearer is practiced with this attack.

trans-unit.source: Form: Hand-knitted scarf with a tag that says MADE WITH LOVE
trans-unit.target: Form: Hand-knitted scarf with a tag that says MADE WITH LOVE

trans-unit.source: Effect: When activated, the scarf can do one of two things (chosen by the user). The scarf must be reactivated to switch the effect.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When activated, the scarf can do one of two things (chosen by the user). The scarf must be reactivated to switch the effect.

trans-unit.source: Love: Creates a magical shield around the user for one hour, during which time they gain +2 Armor (+3 Armor if the artifact is level 5 or higher).
trans-unit.target: Love: Creates a magical shield around the user for one hour, during which time they gain +2 Armor (+3 Armor if the artifact is level 5 or higher).

trans-unit.source: Death: For the next hour, each time the user attacks someone in short range, the scarf snaps out in that same action and inflicts 2 additional points of damage (3 points if the artifact is level 5 or higher).
trans-unit.target: Death: For the next hour, each time the user attacks someone in short range, the scarf snaps out in that same action and inflicts 2 additional points of damage (3 points if the artifact is level 5 or higher).

trans-unit.source: Form: Safety whistle in the shape of a woman with bird wings and a fish tail
trans-unit.target: Form: Safety whistle in the shape of a woman with bird wings and a fish tail

trans-unit.source: Effect: Blowing into the whistle creates no sound, but instead causes a siren to appear. The siren sings a brief song. The user chooses a number of targets within long range who can hear it equal to the artifact level. The user makes an Intellect attack against each; affected targets each take 3 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor).
trans-unit.target: Effect: Blowing into the whistle creates no sound, but instead causes a siren to appear. The siren sings a brief song. The user chooses a number of targets within long range who can hear it equal to the artifact level. The user makes an Intellect attack against each; affected targets each take 3 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor).

trans-unit.source: Form: Reading glasses with blue-hued lenses
trans-unit.target: Form: Reading glasses with blue-hued lenses

trans-unit.source: Effect: Allows the user to quickly read and understand almost anything within short range, such as a book, long article, important document, and so on, even if it’s not in a language they know. Reading something usually takes at least a few rounds, depending on the length of the item.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Allows the user to quickly read and understand almost anything within short range, such as a book, long article, important document, and so on, even if it’s not in a language they know. Reading something usually takes at least a few rounds, depending on the length of the item.

trans-unit.source: For the next ten minutes per artifact level, the user remembers everything they read perfectly, and if they take any actions pertaining to that knowledge, their task is eased. At the end of that time, all of their newly gained knowledge disappears. They can only use the speed readers on the same item once.
trans-unit.target: For the next ten minutes per artifact level, the user remembers everything they read perfectly, and if they take any actions pertaining to that knowledge, their task is eased. At the end of that time, all of their newly gained knowledge disappears. They can only use the speed readers on the same item once.

trans-unit.source: Form: Tattoo of a nonmagical creature, such as a tiger, spider, domesticated dog, raven, or horse
trans-unit.target: Form: Tattoo of a nonmagical creature, such as a tiger, spider, domesticated dog, raven, or horse

trans-unit.source: Effect: Allows the user to shapeshift into the form of the creature depicted in the tattoo. The creature is nearly impossible to tell from other creatures of its ilk, meaning it’s the same size, moves the same way, vocalizes the same way, has the same coloration, and so on. Once shapeshifted, the user can only do things that the creature could do in its normal state, such as run, roar, fly, swim, and so on. They cannot do things as a human would, but they could talk as a raven might talk, use a device as a primate might, and so on. The shapeshifted user otherwise retains their base stats. The form lasts for ten minutes per artifact level.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Allows the user to shapeshift into the form of the creature depicted in the tattoo. The creature is nearly impossible to tell from other creatures of its ilk, meaning it’s the same size, moves the same way, vocalizes the same way, has the same coloration, and so on. Once shapeshifted, the user can only do things that the creature could do in its normal state, such as run, roar, fly, swim, and so on. They cannot do things as a human would, but they could talk as a raven might talk, use a device as a primate might, and so on. The shapeshifted user otherwise retains their base stats. The form lasts for ten minutes per artifact level.

trans-unit.source: Because tattoo artifacts are magical, they can be transferred from one person’s skin to another’s. For example, if a character kills someone with a still-usable tattoo, they can press their skin to the tattoo and it will appear on their body.
trans-unit.target: Because tattoo artifacts are magical, they can be transferred from one person’s skin to another’s. For example, if a character kills someone with a still-usable tattoo, they can press their skin to the tattoo and it will appear on their body.

trans-unit.source: Form: Tattoo of a skull, bones, or other body part with ink made from ashes of the dead
trans-unit.target: Form: Tattoo of a skull, bones, or other body part with ink made from ashes of the dead

trans-unit.source: Effect: Each time the user would die, the tattoo brings them back to life and restores 5 points to each of their Pools. However, all of their Pools are permanently reduced by 1 each time.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Each time the user would die, the tattoo brings them back to life and restores 5 points to each of their Pools. However, all of their Pools are permanently reduced by 1 each time.

trans-unit.source: Form: Tattoo of a projectile, such as a bullet, arrow, or spear, crafted with ink made with blood
trans-unit.target: Form: Tattoo of a projectile, such as a bullet, arrow, or spear, crafted with ink made with blood

trans-unit.source: Effect: Adds +1 damage to all of the user’s successful ranged attacks that are made with physical weapons, such as a bow, gun, or throwing knife.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Adds +1 damage to all of the user’s successful ranged attacks that are made with physical weapons, such as a bow, gun, or throwing knife.

trans-unit.source: Form: Watch with no face and no hands
trans-unit.target: Form: Watch with no face and no hands

trans-unit.source: Effect: The user can tell the watch what time it is, and it will be that time for them and only them. The watch face shows them a video of what they were experiencing in the past or will experience in the future (depending on what time they chose). The user cannot change anything about the experience, but they can replay and slow down the video. The video lasts for a number of minutes equal to the artifact level and disappears after. Note that while the video of the past is always accurate, the video of the future shows one of many possible futures and may not come true.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The user can tell the watch what time it is, and it will be that time for them and only them. The watch face shows them a video of what they were experiencing in the past or will experience in the future (depending on what time they chose). The user cannot change anything about the experience, but they can replay and slow down the video. The video lasts for a number of minutes equal to the artifact level and disappears after. Note that while the video of the past is always accurate, the video of the future shows one of many possible futures and may not come true.

trans-unit.source: Form: Umbrella that folds down to the size of a credit card
trans-unit.target: Form: Umbrella that folds down to the size of a credit card

trans-unit.source: Effect: When opened, the umbrella grants the user protection from more than just the rain for one minute. Any creature attempting to come within immediate distance of the user stops short and their turn ends if their level is equal to or less than the umbrella’s. PCs gain an Intellect defense roll to overcome the effect.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When opened, the umbrella grants the user protection from more than just the rain for one minute. Any creature attempting to come within immediate distance of the user stops short and their turn ends if their level is equal to or less than the umbrella’s. PCs gain an Intellect defense roll to overcome the effect.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (roll each use); works as a regular umbrella after depletion
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (roll each use); works as a regular umbrella after depletion

trans-unit.source: Form: Handheld mirror or small vanity with a special button shaped like a crown
trans-unit.target: Form: Handheld mirror or small vanity with a special button shaped like a crown

trans-unit.source: Effect: The user activates the artifact by pressing the button and staring into the mirror for one minute. As long as they do some type of personal grooming (such as showering, getting dressed, or applying makeup) within short range of the vanity, no time passes for them, allowing them to spend as much time as they need to get ready.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The user activates the artifact by pressing the button and staring into the mirror for one minute. As long as they do some type of personal grooming (such as showering, getting dressed, or applying makeup) within short range of the vanity, no time passes for them, allowing them to spend as much time as they need to get ready.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d00 (check each hour of extra time granted to the user); after depletion, its magic stops working but it continues to function as a normal mirror
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d00 (check each hour of extra time granted to the user); after depletion, its magic stops working but it continues to function as a normal mirror

trans-unit.source: Form: Wooden wand of exceptional quality
trans-unit.target: Form: Wooden wand of exceptional quality

trans-unit.source: Effect: This wand grants its wielder an asset on attack rolls with spells cast while holding it.
trans-unit.target: Effect: This wand grants its wielder an asset on attack rolls with spells cast while holding it.

trans-unit.source: Effect: As a flying vehicle, the broom can be ridden a long distance each round. On extended trips, it can move up to 100 miles (160 km) per hour.
trans-unit.target: Effect: As a flying vehicle, the broom can be ridden a long distance each round. On extended trips, it can move up to 100 miles (160 km) per hour.

trans-unit.source: The bearer can call upon the broom to grant them a powerful hallucinogenic state that lasts for four hours, during which time all tasks are hindered. After the hallucinations end, the bearer’s Intellect tasks are eased for the next ten minutes.
trans-unit.target: The bearer can call upon the broom to grant them a powerful hallucinogenic state that lasts for four hours, during which time all tasks are hindered. After the hallucinations end, the bearer’s Intellect tasks are eased for the next ten minutes.

trans-unit.source: Form: Adult onesie in the form of an animal, imaginary creature, or other entity that adjusts to fit the wearer perfectly.
trans-unit.target: Form: Adult onesie in the form of an animal, imaginary creature, or other entity that adjusts to fit the wearer perfectly.

trans-unit.source: Effect: When worn, the onesie acts as light armor, but grants an additional +1 Armor (+2 if the artifact is level 9 or higher) in addition to the 1 Armor that light armor typically provides. Additionally, the user has an asset on all Intellect defense rolls.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When worn, the onesie acts as light armor, but grants an additional +1 Armor (+2 if the artifact is level 9 or higher) in addition to the 1 Armor that light armor typically provides. Additionally, the user has an asset on all Intellect defense rolls.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: — (At any time, the GM can rule that the onesie has resisted enough Intellect attacks to deplete that ability, after which it still functions as armor.)
trans-unit.target: Depletion: — (At any time, the GM can rule that the onesie has resisted enough Intellect attacks to deplete that ability, after which it still functions as armor.)

trans-unit.source: Form: Well-loved and well-worn leather jacket with the patch of a large winged creature on the back
trans-unit.target: Form: Well-loved and well-worn leather jacket with the patch of a large winged creature on the back

trans-unit.source: Effect: When worn, it makes the user appear tough and badass, providing an asset to all interactions involving coercion, persuasion, fear, and intimidation. Roll a d6 to determine the jacket’s secondary ability.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When worn, it makes the user appear tough and badass, providing an asset to all interactions involving coercion, persuasion, fear, and intimidation. Roll a d6 to determine the jacket’s secondary ability.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: — for the main effect, 1 in 1d10 for the secondary ability (check each use)
trans-unit.target: Depletion: — for the main effect, 1 in 1d10 for the secondary ability (check each use)

trans-unit.source: Metal spikes appear along the sleeves,{1}shoulders, and back, providing +1 Armor and +1 damage on unarmed attacks for a number of rounds equal to the artifact level.
trans-unit.target: Metal spikes appear along the sleeves,{1}shoulders, and back, providing +1 Armor and +1 damage on unarmed attacks for a number of rounds equal to the artifact level.

trans-unit.source: The wings of the creature emerge from the back of the jacket, allowing the wearer to fly for a number of rounds equal to the artifact level.
trans-unit.target: The wings of the creature emerge from the back of the jacket, allowing the wearer to fly for a number of rounds equal to the artifact level.

trans-unit.source: The jacket taunts a foe selected by the wearer within short range for one minute. If the wearer succeeds on an Intellect attack, the foe selectively targets the wearer over other enemies for the duration. The wearer gains an asset on combat tasks, such as attacking and{1}defending, for a number of rounds equal to the artifact level.
trans-unit.target: The jacket taunts a foe selected by the wearer within short range for one minute. If the wearer succeeds on an Intellect attack, the foe selectively targets the wearer over other enemies for the duration. The wearer gains an asset on combat tasks, such as attacking and{1}defending, for a number of rounds equal to the artifact level.

trans-unit.source: Bargainer fiends are natives of “hell dimensions” whose job is to come to the mortal world and convince people to barter or trade their souls. Their natural shape is usually a lanky humanoid with horns, claws, vestigial bat wings, and a forked tail, with a faint smell of brimstone, but they can partially or completely disguise themselves as humans to tempt and advise mortals.
trans-unit.target: Bargainer fiends are natives of “hell dimensions” whose job is to come to the mortal world and convince people to barter or trade their souls. Their natural shape is usually a lanky humanoid with horns, claws, vestigial bat wings, and a forked tail, with a faint smell of brimstone, but they can partially or completely disguise themselves as humans to tempt and advise mortals.

trans-unit.source: Typical devils are warriors and torturers, and demons are mortal souls reforged into entities of pure spite and hate, whereas bargainer fiends see themselves as classier beings with loftier goals. However, bargainers are aware that they are weaker than their counterparts, and they make sure they don’t do any front-line fighting if they can help it.
trans-unit.target: Typical devils are warriors and torturers, and demons are mortal souls reforged into entities of pure spite and hate, whereas bargainer fiends see themselves as classier beings with loftier goals. However, bargainers are aware that they are weaker than their counterparts, and they make sure they don’t do any front-line fighting if they can help it.

trans-unit.source: Environment: Anywhere humans can be found
trans-unit.target: Environment: Anywhere humans can be found

trans-unit.source: Combat: A bargainer fiend attacks with a punch or a firearm. If they aren’t trying to hide their inhuman nature, they throw short-range bolts of painful hellfire, inflicting 4 points of damage and stunning the target for one round.
trans-unit.target: Combat: A bargainer fiend attacks with a punch or a firearm. If they aren’t trying to hide their inhuman nature, they throw short-range bolts of painful hellfire, inflicting 4 points of damage and stunning the target for one round.

trans-unit.source: The heart of a bargainer fiend’s power is its ability to arrange for rewards for a mortal client in exchange for the client’s soul. Typical rewards are training in a skill, learning a new type or focus ability, wealth equivalent to one exorbitant item, an artifact, or anything else that can be acquired by spending 4 XP. The price is always the client’s mortal soul, usually after a specific time period. Bigger demands by the client require the fiend to get approval from their superiors, and the price is higher, but usually still manageable.
trans-unit.target: The heart of a bargainer fiend’s power is its ability to arrange for rewards for a mortal client in exchange for the client’s soul. Typical rewards are training in a skill, learning a new type or focus ability, wealth equivalent to one exorbitant item, an artifact, or anything else that can be acquired by spending 4 XP. The price is always the client’s mortal soul, usually after a specific time period. Bigger demands by the client require the fiend to get approval from their superiors, and the price is higher, but usually still manageable.

trans-unit.source: A bargainer fiend can use an action to transform themself into a human or near-human form (such as a human with devil horns) or return to their natural form. They can assume the guise of a specific human (such as a person their client knows) only if that human is dead or has an agreement with a bargainer fiend.
trans-unit.target: A bargainer fiend can use an action to transform themself into a human or near-human form (such as a human with devil horns) or return to their natural form. They can assume the guise of a specific human (such as a person their client knows) only if that human is dead or has an agreement with a bargainer fiend.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Bargainer fiends serve at the pleasure of their infernal masters, and they know their lives are forfeit if they ever fail. This colors their interactions with clients; they will say anything to accomplish their mission, and their only true loyalty is to the fiend who created and controls them.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Bargainer fiends serve at the pleasure of their infernal masters, and they know their lives are forfeit if they ever fail. This colors their interactions with clients; they will say anything to accomplish their mission, and their only true loyalty is to the fiend who created and controls them.

trans-unit.source: Use: A motivational speaker offers to teach clients confidence and charm, with great results. An old sorcerer knows some rare magic for those willing to pay a steep price. A mysterious person has been seen visiting people in the terminal ward of various hospitals.
trans-unit.target: Use: A motivational speaker offers to teach clients confidence and charm, with great results. An old sorcerer knows some rare magic for those willing to pay a steep price. A mysterious person has been seen visiting people in the terminal ward of various hospitals.

trans-unit.source: Loot: A bargainer fiend may have a cypher relating to their duties or as a gift or payment for a client, but most of their material riches are hell-crafted and not safe to carry for long.
trans-unit.target: Loot: A bargainer fiend may have a cypher relating to their duties or as a gift or payment for a client, but most of their material riches are hell-crafted and not safe to carry for long.

trans-unit.source: Divinities of the city are a pantheon of modern-era demigods who have a strong connection to some aspect of urban life. They get their powers from their connection to a modern element that’s being worshipped. For example, the Divinity of Defacement gains power when someone creates graffiti or stares in wonder at a mural, while the Divinity of Urban Creatures grows stronger each time someone saves a turtle from a highway or shivers at coyotes’ calls. Divinities look mostly humanoid, but their appearance has some tie to their connection. The Divinity of Defacement might wear graffiti-themed clothing, the Divinity of Urban Creatures might have a bear’s head, and the Divinity of Architecture might have gargoyle wings.
trans-unit.target: Divinities of the city are a pantheon of modern-era demigods who have a strong connection to some aspect of urban life. They get their powers from their connection to a modern element that’s being worshipped. For example, the Divinity of Defacement gains power when someone creates graffiti or stares in wonder at a mural, while the Divinity of Urban Creatures grows stronger each time someone saves a turtle from a highway or shivers at coyotes’ calls. Divinities look mostly humanoid, but their appearance has some tie to their connection. The Divinity of Defacement might wear graffiti-themed clothing, the Divinity of Urban Creatures might have a bear’s head, and the Divinity of Architecture might have gargoyle wings.

trans-unit.source: Combat: Divinities attack a foe up to a long distance away with a spell related to their connection (sending a pack of rabid raccoons after a foe, lifting a highway, or having a mural attack). These attacks inflict 8 points of damage on a single target or, if the divinity chooses, the attack hits all targets within short range of the destination for 6 points of damage.
trans-unit.target: Combat: Divinities attack a foe up to a long distance away with a spell related to their connection (sending a pack of rabid raccoons after a foe, lifting a highway, or having a mural attack). These attacks inflict 8 points of damage on a single target or, if the divinity chooses, the attack hits all targets within short range of the destination for 6 points of damage.

trans-unit.source: Most divinities have a close-range attack as well, such as turning into a coyote and attacking their target with tooth and claw or grabbing a painted weapon out of a wall mural.
trans-unit.target: Most divinities have a close-range attack as well, such as turning into a coyote and attacking their target with tooth and claw or grabbing a painted weapon out of a wall mural.

trans-unit.source: Divinities also have a number of additional spells, including:
trans-unit.target: Divinities also have a number of additional spells, including:

trans-unit.source: Animate: Turns any material into an animate level 4 creature. The creature has a mind and will of its own, and acts just as that type of creature would act if it were born instead of created.
trans-unit.target: Animate: Turns any material into an animate level 4 creature. The creature has a mind and will of its own, and acts just as that type of creature would act if it were born instead of created.

trans-unit.source: Forever Space: Creates an endless length of alleys, roads, or bridges between itself and all characters it chooses within long range. Characters must succeed on a level 5 Intellect defense task to find an exit. While moving through the forever space, characters take 2 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor) each round.
trans-unit.target: Forever Space: Creates an endless length of alleys, roads, or bridges between itself and all characters it chooses within long range. Characters must succeed on a level 5 Intellect defense task to find an exit. While moving through the forever space, characters take 2 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor) each round.

trans-unit.source: Heal: The divinity heals themself, a creature, or an object for 5 points of damage.
trans-unit.target: Heal: The divinity heals themself, a creature, or an object for 5 points of damage.

trans-unit.source: Illusion: Divinities can cast elaborate and convincing illusions over their domain, making the area seem more appealing, beautiful, or dangerous. Illusions cover up to a ten-block area and last for up to an hour. Seeing through one is a level 8 task.
trans-unit.target: Illusion: Divinities can cast elaborate and convincing illusions over their domain, making the area seem more appealing, beautiful, or dangerous. Illusions cover up to a ten-block area and last for up to an hour. Seeing through one is a level 8 task.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Divinities rarely care about humans unless they’re connected to their particular part of the urban landscape. Sometimes they can be persuaded or negotiated with, but not if the character has previously damaged or endangered the divinity’s connection—for example, a poacher of urban wildlife probably has no chance of interacting positively with a Divinity of Urban Creatures.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Divinities rarely care about humans unless they’re connected to their particular part of the urban landscape. Sometimes they can be persuaded or negotiated with, but not if the character has previously damaged or endangered the divinity’s connection—for example, a poacher of urban wildlife probably has no chance of interacting positively with a Divinity of Urban Creatures.

trans-unit.source: Use: A divinity is a powerful aggressive or defensive force, putting the PCs in a position where they must fight or negotiate to prevent death and destruction. In addition to situations where a divinity clashes with those who would exploit them, they may have information or unique magic (such as an unlocking spell) that the characters need to reach a goal.
trans-unit.target: Use: A divinity is a powerful aggressive or defensive force, putting the PCs in a position where they must fight or negotiate to prevent death and destruction. In addition to situations where a divinity clashes with those who would exploit them, they may have information or unique magic (such as an unlocking spell) that the characters need to reach a goal.

trans-unit.source: Loot: Divinities rarely carry anything of interest to humans, but they might bequeath to allies a powerful artifact related to some aspect of their domain.
trans-unit.target: Loot: Divinities rarely carry anything of interest to humans, but they might bequeath to allies a powerful artifact related to some aspect of their domain.

trans-unit.source: Electricity elementals alternate between a feral-looking humanoid energy form and a near-spherical cloud of intensely glowing sparks. They spontaneously arise when supernatural events take place near high-voltage wires or electrical substations, and their high rate of speed often means they’ve traveled hundreds of miles before anyone realizes they appeared. Extremely mobile and curious, they inadvertently or deliberately cause harm wherever they go.
trans-unit.target: Electricity elementals alternate between a feral-looking humanoid energy form and a near-spherical cloud of intensely glowing sparks. They spontaneously arise when supernatural events take place near high-voltage wires or electrical substations, and their high rate of speed often means they’ve traveled hundreds of miles before anyone realizes they appeared. Extremely mobile and curious, they inadvertently or deliberately cause harm wherever they go.

trans-unit.source: Environment: Anywhere electricity can easily reach
trans-unit.target: Environment: Anywhere electricity can easily reach

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short; very long with electrical conduction
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short; very long with electrical conduction

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Attacks and Speed defense as level 5 due to quickness; stealth as level 2 due to buzzing noise
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Attacks and Speed defense as level 5 due to quickness; stealth as level 2 due to buzzing noise

trans-unit.source: Combat: An electricity elemental strikes twice each round with a limb, or fires one bolt of electricity at a target within short range.
trans-unit.target: Combat: An electricity elemental strikes twice each round with a limb, or fires one bolt of electricity at a target within short range.

trans-unit.source: As its action, an elemental can heal itself for up to 4 points of health by draining power from a touched electrical machine, creature (such as a robot), manifest cypher, or artifact. A drained object moves one step down the object damage track. A drained robot takes 4 points of damage. A drained manifest cypher is fully consumed and useless. A drained artifact immediately checks for depletion (artifacts with a depletion of “—” are either immune to this ability or have a depletion of 1 in 1d10 for this purpose).
trans-unit.target: As its action, an elemental can heal itself for up to 4 points of health by draining power from a touched electrical machine, creature (such as a robot), manifest cypher, or artifact. A drained object moves one step down the object damage track. A drained robot takes 4 points of damage. A drained manifest cypher is fully consumed and useless. A drained artifact immediately checks for depletion (artifacts with a depletion of “—” are either immune to this ability or have a depletion of 1 in 1d10 for this purpose).
